ResponsesInList.Title: Some questions set order, others randomized/shuffle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Haven't used questionnaire yet but it seems it may work well to support an anonymous survey (mixed Likert, drop down & open ended) with no login required. While the forums and documention have been helpful, I still can't seem to figure out: can I have questions 1-10 in set order, 11-20 randomized/shuffle?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some questions set order, others randomized/shuffle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Ki Kara, I don't understand why you would want to shuffle the order of questions in a survey-type of activity. There is no such feature in Questionnaire. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some questions set order, others randomized/shuffle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Joseph, for your response. Much appreciated. Now I now I don't need to keep persuing this any longer. As way of explanation, I'll be asking people to react to some scenarios of possible futures. I wanted to keep the initial demographic questions together as one group, in set order, but shuffle the order of the scenarios (to prevent survey fagitue). Survey Monkey doesn't support this (randomizes multiple choice answers to each question only) and other software that looks promising (Survey Gizmo) is outside my budget. I'd explored Question Bank, but the quiz feature in Moodle wasn't offering the types of questions and flexibility I needed so I thought perhaps Questionnaire would work. In the end, I may just create 3 versions of the survey in Survey Monkey and do it that way. Thanks again, Kara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some questions set order, others randomized/shuffle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Kara, Thanks for the explanation. You see, the problem is that usually survey type of activities such as Questionnaire (in Moodle) are supposed to gather data which will ultimately exported to either a spreadsheet or a more sophisticated stats package in order to examine the data and possibly draw conclusions from it. If the questions are shuffled when presented to the student, then this can lead to all kind of problems later on upon export and data-mining. In your list of survey software you don't mention LimeSurvey . I don't know if it would to what you want, but it's a good alternative to Moodle's questionnaire, except that it would be totally outside of your moodle site, of course. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Incomplete responses query
ResponsesInList.Text: Has the incomplete responses option been removed? In the old version running on our Moodle 3.6 there was an option in CSV Download for these to be included. i.e. "Include incomplete responses" - this was useful. In the version I am using now in Moodle 3.8 this seems to have been replaced with "Include rank question averages" and I can't see any way to access incomplete responses. Am I missing something? Is there a way that Incomplete responses can still be accessed? Thanks for any information and advice on this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Incomplete responses query
ResponsesInList.Text: There was a regression. This was identified in https://github.com/PoetOS/moodle-mod_questionnaire/pull/304 . It has been fixed in MOODLE_39_STABLE and will be released soon.

ResponsesInList.Title: Printing / Copy paste

I would like to ask you for a functionality that would improve even more this plugin and sure help a lot of people using it. I'm talking about printing / copypaste the VIEW ALL ANSWERS / SUMMARY / VIEW DEFAULT ORDER feedback. I'm using this plugin to collect students feedback related to the teachers work and I can only copy/paste the numerical feedback. The graphical feedback just don't paste to a word sheet, and we need to have this graphical view available in order to send to the teachers. Many thanks in advance. Keep up with the fine work. Luís

ResponsesInList.Title: A more user-friendly interface for Questions editing
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks to Daniele Cordella's excellent suggestions, I have almost finalized a more user-friendly interface for Questions editing in the Questionaire module. As usual, just before committing it to CVS (for moodle 1.9 first and hopefully for 1.8 as well later on) I invite all Questionnaire users to test it on my moodle test site . Log in as teacher1, password teacher1 (or teacher2, teacher2). Create your own questionnaire or edit an existing one, and pay attention to the "new look" of the Questions editing page. Please report any bugs, remarks, etc. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A more user-friendly interface for Questions editing
ResponsesInList.Text: Joseph, Hi! IMO , it's much easier to add new radio button questions now - you can copy and paste possible answers from one question to the next really easily now. Brilliant! Thanks for all the hard work! Sacha

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A more user-friendly interface for Questions editing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sacha, Thanks, but the credit for the new interface of the radio buttons (and check boxes and drop-down list) must go to Daniele Cordella... I have also just added a new feature which you may find useful if you create a lot of similar questions; the "save as new question feature". This allows you to "copy" an existing question to a new question, just making a few changes. Please test it on my test site as usual. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A more user-friendly interface for Questions editing
ResponsesInList.Text: The recent enhancements to the Questions editing page of the Questionnaire module have been committed to CONTRIB and are available for download for both Moodle 1.8 and 1.9. Translators, please check the changes in the lang. questionnaire.php file and the Help files (where there have been a number of changes). Please send me the translated files so I can put them in contrib. Language files are the same for 1.8 and 1.9 so you only need to update your translations for one or the other version and I will do the necessary update in CONTRIB. Thanks a lot for your cooperation! Another good news is that Mike and myself are working on an even more "moodle-like" version of Questionnaire. This new version will respect the latest moodle standards and take into account both Groups and roles. This will shortly be available for testing in HEAD (Moodle 2.0) and will hopefully be backported to 1.9 in due time. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: questionnaire responses associated with wrong course
ResponsesInList.Text: We have a questionnaire shared with multiple courses. Students have filled it out and their responses have been stored in the main course as expected, except some of the student's answers are associated with the wrong course - not the course the student filled out the questtionnare, and for courses that the student's are not even enrolled in. This didn't happen for all students and wouldn't have been noticed if the answers to the questions didn't make sense to the course they were recorded against. After talking to the student, they said they filled out the questionnaire in the correct course (not the course for which their answers got recorded). We're on 1.9.11 of moodle. From looking in the database , it doesn't look like there's any way to determine what responses are correctly associated with their course and which ones aren't. It'd be nice if there was, but we're more concerned with how this happened, and how to prevent again.  Anyone else run in to something like this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire responses associated with wrong course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dave, could you supply more info please? I suppose that questionnaire was first created as "public" in the course you call "the main course". Are students enroled in that course? ( They should not ). Then I suppose questionnaire instances were created in other courses, by copying that "public questionnaire". Are the students enroled in more than one course where those instances were created from the public questionnaire? If you would give us the full scenario, then I might try to reproduce it and find out about your problem. "some of the student's answers are associated with the wrong course" What does that mean exactly? ATB Joseph EDIT.- I've just tried to reproduce the problem on my local moodle 1.9 test site and couldn't.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire responses associated with wrong course
ResponsesInList.Text: It's my understanding that there are students enrolled in the "main" course that hosts the questionnaire. It was a "public" questionnaire , was shared to other courses, and students can (and are) enrolled in multiple courses that the questionnaire was shared with. Is that a problem, if they are in enrolled in multiple courses that have the shared questionnaire? What I mean by "student's answers are associated with the wrong course" is that when we download the answers to text file (from the main course), that student's answers say they correlate to course 1058 (it's one of the fields in the download file), but the student isn't enrolled in 1058, and that student's answers are really in response to the questionnaire shared in course 1078. (We spoke with the student so we know what course the questionnaire was filled out in.) Does that make more sense? I'm not sure how else to describe it. The full scenario: Our faculty wanted to use the questionnaire as a course evaluation, which they read other schools were doing. They created a questionnaire in one of their existing courses, shared to other courses and asked students to fill it out. The questionnaire (course evaluation) was shared with all business department courses so students would be in multiple business courses, but would fill out a separate questionnaire in each course. The instructor of the "main" course would download the answers and distribute them out to the appropriate instructors as appropriate. It sounds like they should have created a new course to house the questionnaire as the "main course" rather than using one of their courses that the students answer the questionnaire in, correct? I've tried to recreate the situation in our test system and haven't been able to.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire responses associated with wrong course
ResponsesInList.Text: 1.- Dave " It sounds like they should have created a new course to house the questionnaire as the "main course" rather than using one of their courses that the students answer the questionnaire in, correct? " Correct! The idea of a public questionnaire is to create it in a "special" course which is not available to students (and even not available to teachers if the responses are to be visible only to the admin, for example). 2.-"Is that a problem, if they are in enrolled in multiple courses that have the shared questionnaire?" Well, if that is the case, nothing prevents the students to answer that questionnaire several times, in each course where they are enroled and where the questionnaire is made available. 3.- "What I mean by "student's answers are associated with the wrong course" is that when we download the answers to text file (from the main course), a) that student's answers say they correlate to course 1058 (it's one of the fields in the download file), but the student isn't enrolled in 1058, b) and that student's answers are really in response to the questionnaire shared in course 1078. (We spoke with the student so we know what course the questionnaire was filled out in.) Does that make more sense? I'm not sure how else to describe it. " a) This seems quite unlikely. b) If the original public questionnaire was copied to several courses on your moodle site, and that student is enrolled in those courses, how can you be certain that that student only answered the questionnaire in course 1078? Anyway, if you cannot reproduce the problem on your moodle site any more than I can reproduce it on my moodle test site, I do not see how we can sort things out. Joseph PS. When you write " [The teachers] created a questionnaire in one of their existing courses, shared to other courses and asked students to fill it out. " it is still not clear to me WHO did WHAT.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire responses associated with wrong course
ResponsesInList.Text: OK. I'll try to explain clearer. The instructor assigned to course 1058 created a public questionnaire and asked the instructors in other courses (like 1078, 1061, etc.) to add the questionnaire to their course. The students enrolled in courses 1058,1078,1061 all answer the questionnaire. The students may be in multiple courses so they might answer the questionnaire mutiple times, but that's OK (with us) since the questionnaire is a course evaluation. When we download the answers to a text file, the course is included along with their responses, so we can sort out what answers go to which course then. Other schools have said they were doing course evaluations this way so we didn't think having a student fill out a questionnaire from multiple courses would be a problem. Is it? We're ok with not being able to sort out things this time, but want to make sure we're using the questionnaire correctly, and that it's going to work the way we need to for next time.

ResponsesInList.Title: Question about the database structure
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear All I'm writing a report to display data from the questionnaire module. I'm trying to understand the database structure of the module. Most of it makes sense, but I don't understand the difference between a questionnaire and a questionnaire survey. I've found the following lines in the /mod/questionnaire/report.php file $instance = optional_param('instance', false, PARAM_INT); // questionnaire ID $sid = optional_param('sid', NULL, PARAM_INT); // Survey id. and the mdl_questionnaire and mdl_questionnaire_survey tables as well as the comments that go with those tables, but I'm no clearer as to what the difference between a questionnaire and a survey, or a questionnaire id and a survey id. If anyone could explain it I'd be very grateful Thanks David Willington

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question about the database structure
ResponsesInList.Text: The questionnaire table contains all of the specific module / activity information, and identifies the survey it uses. The questionnaire_survey table contains all of the information about the survey and helps identify its questions. For a questionnaire to exist somewhere in Moodle it must have an activity added somewhere to a course. It will use a survey. More than one questionnaire can use the same survey. Hope this helps. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: forcing login as guest
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a questionnarie on the main page of my Moodle and I would like that everybody can fill it in (it is defined as anonymous/everybody can fill/multiple answers). If the user is already logged in with a username or as "guest", everything works, otherwise s/he is sent to the login page (a behaviour I wish to avoid in this case). If the questionnaire is located within a course and linked to from the main page, there is no problem, since the user is automatically logged into that course as guest. But I would prefer to keep the questionnaire on the main page. How can I get the user automatically logged in as guest? Is this something I have to define within the questionnaire code or elsewhere? Thank you for your help Francesco

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: forcing login as guest
ResponsesInList.Text: There's a site setting, "autologinguests", that should do it for you. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: forcing login as guest
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Mike, but I cannot find out how to set the "autologinguests" variable on the main page. I have set "autologinguests" on in a course I use now as holder for questionnaires. I put then a link from the main page to that questionnaire (with a retour link in the "thank you for filling..." page) and everything works, but it would be cleaner to keep the questionnaire on the main page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple rating scales for single question
ResponsesInList.Text: This one a bit unusual, but is there any way to have 2 rating scales for a single question? I wiould like to ask students to rate certain activities based on the frequency it is performed, and also on the importance of the activity. Some activities may be performed rarely, but are neverthelss important. These would need to be 2 x 1-5 scales, but I would prefer not to ask each question twice. Something like this. Frequency of activity Importance Never Always Not Important Very Important Activity 1 Activity 2 Activity 3 Activity 4 Activity 5

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple rating scales for single question
ResponsesInList.Text: There is no way to ask for two separate ratings in one question, no. There is just the rate scale question currently - https://docs.moodle.org/29/en/Editing_Questionnaire_questions#Rate_.28scale_1..5.29 . Perhaps you could use the Osgoode format described there? mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Restricted Access
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there a way to set a questionnaire to provide a different "mark" based on the answers?  I would like to have one "yes/no" question that if answered "no" ends the questionnaire and opens up the Activity A but if answered "yes" moves on to the next question.  Then if the next question result is "no" it ends the questionnaire and opens up Activity B but if answered "yes" opens up Activity A. I realize that a quiz is probably a better option here but we need the report of the questions asked to look like the one the questionnaire provides instead of just a grade book.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restricted Access
ResponsesInList.Text: Questionnaire only provides one grade - and that is for submission. So you could set up a completion rule that you cannot do an activity until a questionnaire is completed, but that is it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "Coding error detected" on checkbox question submission
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Donna, Which version of Moodle are you using? This bug was reported and fixed in the bug tracker issue CONTRIB-3318 . Please upgrade your Questionnaire plugin to the latest available version on github here: https://github.com/remotelearner/moodle-mod_questionnaire/zipball/MOODLE_22_STABLE Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi We are using moodle 1.9 with questionnaire module installed. In our set up, a public questionnaire is created by administrator which is used by all faculty in their courses to get student feedback. The questionnaire output is processed using a software to generate pdf reports. Unlike in moodle 1.8, when questionnaire data is retrieved, for each question, now the file gives the choice number instead of the actual choice text. For example, if the different choices for a question are a)Excellent b)Very Good c)Satisfactory, in the old version, the actual choice text would be recorded in the questionnaire file, but in moodle 1.9, it records the choice number (i think). Can I get the behaviour available in moodle 1.8 questionnaire? thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Suresh, The reason for the different behavior you see between 1.8 and 1.9 versions of the Questionnaire module is that I have spent a lot of time - in answer to Marija's request - to make the data exported by Questionnaire as straightforwardly useable as possible in a stats package. Statistical packages will want to use numbers to produce tables, statistics and graphs, not words. So my answer is that if you need the original wording of choices rather than the choice numbers, you can do it very easily in Excel or the stats package. For example, if you import the exported data file of results from Moodle -Questionnaire into Excel you might get this table: Response Submitted on: Institution Department Course Group ID Full name Username Q01_favorite color 332 29/10/2008 12:15 Course Fullname 101 3 Bella Ben benbella 2 333 29/10/2008 12:16 Course Fullname 101 4 Dupont Jean dupont 3 Using Excel's Search & Replace on the Q01_favorite color column you can easily change 1 to blue, 2 to red and 3 to yellow and get: Response Submitted on: Institution Department Course Group ID Full name Username Q01_favorite color 332 29/10/2008 12:15 Course Fullname 101 3 Bella Ben benbella red 333 29/10/2008 12:16 Course Fullname 101 4 Dupont Jean dupont yellow

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph - I haven't been keeping up with all these changes... Was there a tracker number for this? I think it might be best to have the option of exporting the choice number, choice text or both. Everyone doesn't use the export for statistical packages - many use it for reports. I'll see what I can come up with. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: Mike, I don't think this went into the tracker. I agree that the best solution would be to have an output option somewhere, so the end-user could choose to export choice number or text (or both). If you can come up with a solution that would be nice. ATB Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: Do you remember where in the code you changed it so that the text wasn't output? mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: Mike, In current 1.9 version, file locallib.php, line 1575 $row->ccontent = (string)$i; will output the choice number $row->ccontent = $content; would output the choice label Ideally the end-user should be given a choice of outputting number or label (or both). I leave it to you to find a suitable solution, ATB Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: The current version in HEAD and MOODLE_19 has the ability to choose how you want those responses downloaded - code, text or both. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire data format regarding
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mike, That was lightning-fast development! Joseph PS.- Should we extend that option for radio buttons to the Yes/No question type? e.g. export Yes/No question answers as either Yes / No 1 / 0 1 : Yes / 0: No (maybe not useful)?

ResponsesInList.Title: Global End of Class Survey
ResponsesInList.Text: We want to create a global survey that can be filled as many times as needed, at the end of a course. We currently have a template but we want to auto-populate certain information on the survey such as the date, course name, trainer and site (location of the office). Is there a way to do this? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Global End of Class Survey
ResponsesInList.Text: There is nothing in questionnaire that can do that. But you could always use a filter plugin, like ' Filtercodes '. Then you could add the text you want into the content of a question.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Global End of Class Survey
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Mike. Will take a look at the plugin.

ResponsesInList.Title: where do I find response's database?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I need the raw data of my questionnaire's single responses because i have to analyse them in spreadsheet. I've been looking everywhere in moodle database and got no luck. I assume that the responses can be found in the table mdl_questionnaire_resp_single but what I found is only Information of Response_id, Question_id and so on. How do i get the content or value of the responses? I'm totally newbie to this topic so really need help. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: where do I find response's database?
ResponsesInList.Text: As a teacher or administrator, click on the questionnaire.  At that point you should see a link to "View all responses."  On the next screen you will find the option to " Download in text format".  This will give you a CSV file which you can open in your spreadsheet.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Import questionnaire WITH responses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nick, I'm not sure why you would want to do this. Could you please expand on your reasons and context ? If you want to export the responses, you'll have to include the users in your export data, of course; maybe this is what you are missing. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Import questionnaire WITH responses

For ease of use we would like all of the content to be available in one place, hence the need to copy a completed questionnaire with user data. I have tried importing with user data but this didn't work. In the meantime I have moved the data to pdf and put that in the target course instead of the full questionnaire.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Import questionnaire WITH responses
ResponsesInList.Text: Nick, Thanks for clarifying. When doing your export, you must not only tick the With Data boxes, but also include in your exporet data all course users (i.e. students who responded).If you don't, then you will see the warning: Note: This backup contains no users and so all activities have been switched to "without user data" mode. I'm glad you found a working solution anyway, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Can Questionnaire track improvement progress (through a course) v1.9.8
ResponsesInList.Text: We run a physical exercise (PE) course and I would like to know if we can use Questionnaire as a survey tool to have students input their endurance times for exercises so that we can track it (and see if specific students need extra help - mentoring). Example:  at the end of week one student 1 was able to do a running exercise for 3 minutes, at the end of week two student 1 was able to do same running exercise for 5 minutes, week three for 7 minutes, etc. We had envisioned creating a private questionnaire (to that PE course) and including that questionnaire in each weeks topics (we use weekly topics).  We can add it but it does not append the answers week to week so there is no way to track progress by user. Is this something that we should be able to do with base Moodle?  If so, what are we missing here?  Is there another method we should use to accomplish this? Eric

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can Questionnaire track improvement progress (through a course) v1.9.8
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Eric, From the online Questionnaire documentation : Select whether users will be allowed to respond once, daily, weekly, monthly or an unlimited number of times ( many ). If you set your questionnaire to be answered weekly, it will sort of "append" the responses and you will be able to view those successive responses by student. To track progress by user, it might be useful to export your questionnaire data into your favorite spreadsheet where you can filter by user, produce diagrams, etc. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire-template bug
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the detailed info. There is a very easy fix for that bug, use textlib function. In Moodle 2.4.2, file questionnaire.class.php line 970, replace `$survey->name = substr($survey->name, 0, (64-10));` with `$survey->name = textlib::substr($survey->name, 0, (64-10));` I have opened issue CONTRIB-4398 in the tracker. Thanks for reporting this bug. Please try out my fix and confirm that it works for you. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire-template bug
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, your fix is correctly work.

ResponsesInList.Title: survey already completed
ResponsesInList.Text: Questionnaire: When an individual enters to begin the survey, he sees a survey already completed. Do I have the setting wrong.  Or, is someone in at the exact same time.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: survey already completed
ResponsesInList.Text: If you are seeing a 'survey already completed' message, this means that the user has already submitted the survey and is not allowed to resubmit. If you are seeing a survey with data filled out already, you have the questionnaire settings set so that 'Resume' is 'Yes', and they have already filled out the surveay and 'Saved' it but not 'Submitted' it. Setting 'Resume' to 'Yes' means that the users can fill out a survey over multiple sessions, retaining their data. When complete, they must use the 'submit' button. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Combining Questionnaire and Quiz for Branching
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle Quiz lacks very important functionality of conditional branching based on answer response to questions. Questionnaire does have this functionality. Is there a way to combine these two seamlessly that users will not even see how its managed at the back end. i.e. User can take quiz and after one of the question he will be directed to Questionnaire and back to Quiz depending on question responses. This was we can bring conditional branching functionality within Quiz. Pls note- I can NOT just use ONLY questionnaire as it doesnot have all the question types I need. So I would have to use Quiz and then leverage Questionnaire within Quiz to handle conditional branching scenario

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Combining Questionnaire and Quiz for Branching
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Anita, " User can take quiz and after one of the question he will be directed to Questionnaire and back to Quiz depending on question responses. " That is quite impossible. What you must understand first of all is that the Moodle Quiz activity is a Test -like activity, whereas Questionnaire is a survey -like activity. Tests are used to test an individual respondent's knowledge , and to give them a score of aptitude. Surveys are used to gather the opinions of a panel of respondents , and do not lead to a score of aptitude. Thus these two types of activities have their own, totally different uses. Your only option , if you want to test a respondent's knowledge or aptitude and use a branching feature, is the Moodle Lesson activity. However, as you may already have noticed, the Lesson activity does not offer the variety of questions that are available to the Quiz activity. Hope that helps, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Restore is failing.
ResponsesInList.Text: When l tried restoring a course today and it said Could not restore modules! I did some testing by restoring the course many times with one module at a time. I found that the Questionnaire module was the one giving the error. I am running 1.5.4 Moodle and the Questionnaire was downloaded on June 13. Any help?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restore is failing - Attn: Mike Churchward
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Mike, I found the problem and the solution. When you backup the questionnaire from an old version and try to restore it into a new version, you get this error.  The is a field in the questionnaire table called qtype. This field used to be enum('unlimited','once') and it is now an interger. So when you try to restore, the insert_record function is trying to insert a string into an integer location, hence it fails. Please add this to the restorelib.php (questionnaire_restore_mods) if ( $questionnaire->qtype == 'unlimited' || $questionnaire->qtype == 'once' ) { $qtype = 0; This will ensure this value is only changed when qtype is one of the two strings. Also, in the questionnaire/db/{ mysql , postgres7}.php files, you need to remove all if ($record->qtype == 'unlimited') { $qtype = 0; } else if ($record->type == 'once') { $qtype = 1; } set_field('questionnaire_response', 'qtype', $qtype, 'id', $record->id from the first part when updating questionnaire_response since this table does not have any field called qtype in function questionnaire_upgrade_2006031700() Please let me know if you have any questions and when this is complete.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restore is failing - Attn: Mike Churchward
ResponsesInList.Text: Has this been fixed in the repository?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restore is failing - Attn: Mike Churchward
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Muwali - Thanks for the problem and fix identification. I have fixed the areas you identified and committed them to CVS . In future, could you also use the bug tracker for issues like this? Sometimes I don't see the forum posts. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Using Questionnaires for Workstation Assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm currently looking at ways a Workstation Assessment can be done on Moodle. The workstation assessment consists of questions such as: Is your chair stable? Does it have a working seat height adjustment? Most of the questions are basic Yes and No questions with a few sentence based answer questions. For certain questions if the user selects 'Yes' then additional questions are shown and the participant has to answer the additional questions, if they select 'No' then the additional questions don't show and the participant can move onto the next mandatory question. At the end once the participant has completed the Workstation Assessment an e-mail needs to be sent to their relevant department admin notifying that they've completed the Workstation Assessment. Has anyone done something similar to this on Moodle? If so how did you go about starting it?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaires for Workstation Assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: You can definitely do that with the questionnaire module. It has the ability to make questions dependent on answers to other questions: https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Adding/editing_a_questionnaire#Allow_branching_questions https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Questionnaire_Conditional_branching And, it can notify specific roles/people when a questionnaire has been completed: https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Adding/editing_a_questionnaire#Send_submission_notifications https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Setting_up_a_questionnaire#Submission_options The feedback module may also be able to do these things. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaires for Workstation Assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Mike, just what I was looking for

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaires for Workstation Assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, do you know which plugin I'd require to be able to have the parent question functionality? I currently can't see options for parent questions. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaires for Workstation Assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Its a standard feature of the questionnaire module. You just need to select the option in the questionnaire settings (see: https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Adding/editing_a_questionnaire#Allow_branching_questions ). Note that only "yes/no", "radio" and "dropdown" questions are eligible to be parent questions. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaires for Workstation Assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, Thanks got it sorted. Regarding the emails part of my query, I've just created a short list to help explain what I meant. Head of Apples Head of Grape Head of Pear Apple 1 Grape 1 Pear 1 Apple 2 Grape 2 Pear 2 Apple 3 Grape 3 Pear 3 So looking at the table above, when a Apple completes the questionnaire then only the Head of Apple will get an email informing that one of the Apple team members have completed the questionnaire. If a Grape completes the questionnaire then only the Head of Grape will get an email ...etc. Is it possible to create something like that on Moodle or does it have to be that when Grape 3 completes the questionnaire, all 3, Head of Apple, Grape and Pear will receive an email saying Grape 3 has completed the questionnaire? Regards, Jit

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaires for Workstation Assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Assuming that your "Apples", "Grape" and "Pear" are Moodle groups, then you can use https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Adding/editing_a_questionnaire#Send_submission_notifications . You need to use "separate" groups, and then as long as the "Heads" have a role that includes 'mod/questionnaire:submissionnotification' and are a member of that group, then they will only receive notifications for that group. mike

ResponsesInList.Text: I have a questionnaire with 45 Rate (scale 1...5) questions - all set to 4 scale items with named degrees.  Users will not complete the questionnaire in one sitting, so at any time several questions are expected to be unanswered. When I export, the answered questions get a value of 0, 1, 2 or 3 as per design, but unanswered questions acquire a value of -999. I've noticed it in CVS , Excel and HTML exports and presume it is by design. Can I override this,?  A null, 0 or blank would work for me - could I somehow have all unanswered questions default to having a value of 0??

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire exports "-999' for unanswered Rate (scale) Qs
ResponsesInList.Text: Are those 45 Rate (scale 1...5) questions set to Response required or Response NOT required? It's not clear if you do an export of the questionnaire responses while the questionnaire is still open and some students may not have completed it yet or if you wait until all students have responded?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire exports "-999' for unanswered Rate (scale) Qs
ResponsesInList.Text: sorry about sdelay in replying. Repsonse to the questions are NOT required And yes I export before all respondents complete or submit the questionnaire - I have SUBMIIbbbT switched off via CSS because I want users to go in and out of the questionnaire, and to see their previously saved answers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Deletando Módulo
ResponsesInList.Text: Olá Pessoal! Gostaria de saber se quando eu deletar um módulo (Questionnaire) e inserí-lo novamente, os questionários já criados serão mantidos ou perderei todos os dados?! Abraços, Daniel Hack

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deletando Módulo
ResponsesInList.Text: Olá Daniel, When you delete a Questionnaire instance, you delete all its questions. There is no "questions bank" for the Questionnaire module, unlike for the Quiz activity. However, if you want to keep a Questionnaire instance's questions without the data, logged in as teacher or admin, simply delete all the responses. Joseph PS.- This is an English-speaking forum.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deletando Módulo
ResponsesInList.Text: I appreciate the feedback and i´m sorry about the language. Actually i want to know about modules and not questionnaire in it self. if i delete the "questionnaire mod" and place it again, through FTP , will i lose the questionnaires created and its answers? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deletando Módulo
ResponsesInList.Text: *FTP Client Software

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deletando Módulo
ResponsesInList.Text: Daniel " if i delete the "questionnaire mod" and place it again, through FTP , will i lose the questionnaires created and its answers?" Yes: when you delete a module, all its instances and of course associated data are deleted from your moodle site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Categorizing Answers

Different users will fill out a survey, which relates to a certain person. Later i have to analyze the data regarding to average values, etc. So far, so good. But now it shows, that the answers have to be categorized for the later report. That´s why: The user doesn´t see the categories, the possible answers are mixed up regarding the categories, but the answers indeed belong to certain categories, for example "social skills" or "projectmanagement abilities", and so on. I can´t think of a way to categorize answers with the questionnaire module, can anybody else? (The only solution which came to my mind is to add a special field to each possible answer, but...how to do?) Now when i export my answers into Excel, i have the answers there, but i don´t know how to sort them into certain categories. Has anybody ideas regarding this problem or has this been done before? Thanks for your help!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: export responses from a questionnaire to Excel file
ResponsesInList.Text: Abd, If you want to export a questionnaire's responses data to a spreadsheet (proprietary MS Excel or open source Open Office Calc), just use the questionnaire plugin's Download in text format feature. Then open the text file in your favorite spreadsheet, making sure to specify that that file is of the CSV (comma separated values) type. There is absolutely no need create a special php script such as the one you attached to your original post. More information in the documentation here . All the best, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback: bug with the "Picture" field?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Upon testing an installation of the "Feedback" module, i noticed that the "picture" field shows a fixed (?) list of countries' flags! Is there a way to make this list "update-able"? We need to be able to upload our own pictures instead. Are we missing something? Thanks, G

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: bug with the "Picture" field?
ResponsesInList.Text: As per the post above, can anyone give us a hint? How to create "Picture" fields if the picture list is fixed to a list of countrie's flags? thanks folks! G

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: bug with the "Picture" field?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I don't think you are missing anything : ) I guess the picture field was designed for surveyees to indicate which countries they come from. That's all. So there's no provision to upload and use our own pictures, which is justified, as I see "feedback" module as a survey, and text is usually sufficient for that purpose. If you have a fixed set of pictures to be used for all feedbacks in your moodle site, you can place them in the "/mod/feedback/item/picture/library" directory (and remove all the flags if you have no use of them : ) If you really need to have customised set of pictures for each feedback, then you will have to hack the lib.php file of the picture item. I have done that for fun, so let me know if you need that hacked file. May I know how you intend to use feedback with pictures?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: bug with the "Picture" field?
ResponsesInList.Text: I like the idea of being able to upload and use pictures. I believe that some work was being done to use the Moodle questions but I am not sure what has transpired (if anything recently). There are instances where I think that pictures would be appropriate for surveys. For example, do you prefer logo A, logo B, or logo C? So if someone wanted to create a feature request for using pictures in feedbacks I would certainly vote for it. Peace - Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: bug with the "Picture" field?
ResponsesInList.Text: I agree. As someone who teaches film and media, having a visual option in the Feedback would be an excellent idea. Strategically, too, we could use it - we are just doing a staff survey re. a new building development so a visual choice/option would be great.

ResponsesInList.Title: https download problems in Internet Explorer
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Having just come across these problems where Internet Explorer says it can't open the site because it is unavailable or cannot be found, I don't think I'm the only one. I've found a solution, so I thought I'd add it here. In report.php, around line 495 is a piece of code that looks like this: header("Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=$name.txt"); header("Content-Type: text/comma-separated-values"); foreach ($output as $row ) { If you replace that with the following, it should work in Internet Explorer 7: header ("200 HTTP/1.0 OK"); # Force the answer to be HTTP/1.0 compatible header("Pragma: public");

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with questionnaire name
ResponsesInList.Text:
I don't really understand the problem here. We need a redirect to main Questionnaire View page. The default wait time is 3 seconds. If preferred you can set it at 0 here: in /mod/questionnaire/qsettings.php line 57: 
```text
redirect ($CFG->
wwwroot
.'/mod/questionnaire/view.php?id='.$questionnaire->cm->id,


 get_string('settingssaved', 'questionnaire'),$delay=0);
```

ResponsesInList.Title: public questionnaire source can't be found
ResponsesInList.Text: We have a handful of courses using the questionnaire plugin as a course evaluation tool.  Originally, these were setup as a single public questionnaire, embedded in a live course (not a hidden one as best practice dictates.)  Also, previously many of our courses used the same questions, but setup as a private questionnaire.  So, essentially, I've got 30-40 questionnaires with all the same content/questions, but they are a mix of public and private. Within our four active courses, I went in recently to change a question's text, and realized that I was looking at a questionnaire based on a public questionnaire that "lived" in another course.  I have gone through every course checking for this question to edit, and cannot nail down where this questionnaire lives. I'm afraid someone may have been trying to solve this and changed one or more of the existing questionnaires from private to public (or vice versa). Two questions here: 1) What happens to a child questionnaire, that is based on a public questionnaire if the public one gets switched to private or template?  Does the ability to edit that child survey completely go away? 2) Other than manually entering every course to check dependency, is there a simpler way to find out what course the source survey lives in?  I've got database access and did look around recently there too, but did not have any luck tying the two together. As a fix, I can simply create a new survey and make it private, however, the course lasts an entire school year, and the grades and data from that original survey are important to keep.  Ideally, i'd like to be able to just edit a question without having to recreate the survey, then copy over grades manually, and reconfigure our external grade database. Thanks for any advice here.

ResponsesInList.Title: Submit capability
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Is it possible to allow someone to view the questionnaire but prevent him from submitting? I tried to deny the submit capability of the user but then he can't even view the questionnaire. Thanks! Yaniv.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit capability
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, You could, as teacher, go to the Preview tab, save that HTML page, and put it in a Course Resource as a static, view-only page. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit capability
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Joseph, But I want to be able to see the questionnaire as it updates as well. What I don't understand is what's the use of the submit capability setting. Is that a bug?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit capability
ResponsesInList.Text: Yaniv "But I want to be able to see the questionnaire as it updates as well." What do you mean? Actually I do not understand what you want to do and for what purpose. Could you please explain? I agree that the wording of the Questionnaire capabilities may be misleading. For example a student with the View capability can view the responses to a Questionnaire (if the Read responses capabilities have been set, of course); but, if the Submit capability has been set OFF for the student role, then a student cannot actually take, i.e. view and submit the questionnaire. This is not a bug, just a question of terminology. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit capability
ResponsesInList.Text: O.k now I understand the meaning of the this capability. What I want to do is to have a  'colleague teacher' role with permissions only for viewing activities . So it will have the permissions to see all the activities (hidden, grouped, closed), but not to edit or participate. Is that possible for the questionnaire module? Yaniv.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit capability
ResponsesInList.Text: Yaniv, Thanks for clarifying. What you want is not possible with the Questionnaire module because, once you start to "view" a questionnaire, you are actually "taking" it and you are supposed to submit it. However, you could very well give that person the "View" capability, so he would be able to view the questionnaire, even answer some questions, but you should tell him NOT TO CLICK on the Submit button at the end, so that his responses will not be taken into account in the questionnaire's statistics. This is the only workaround I can think of at the moment, Joseph

Is it just me or is this confusing?  I think it the view all responses page should be clearer that only completed responses are displayed - and the message at the top should only count them.  And the delete page should be clearer that complete and incomplete responses are displayed, and include the total count.  Otherwise, people might wonder where some of the responses have gone?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Counting responses
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, I have now tested on latest version 2.5 available, that's 2.5.8 (Build - 2013122200). Short Questionnaire with 4 Yes/No questions, set to Save: Yes. Questions 1 and 3 required, Questions 2 and 4 not required. Student 01 answers ALL questions and Submits. Teacher report shows: View All Responses. Responses: 1 . Student 02 answers ALL required questions and Submits. Teacher report shows: View All Responses. Responses: 2 . Teacher tries to delete Question 1 (Required) and gets warning "This will also delete the 2 response(s) already given to that question." Teacher tries to delete one Question 2 (Non-Required) and gets warning "This will also delete the 1 response(s) already given to that question." (works as expected). Student 03 answers questions 1 (required) and 2 (not required) and saves. Teacher report shows: View All Responses. Responses: 2 . This works as expected: only 2 complete responses have been submitted so far. Student 04 answers ALL questions and Submits. Teacher report shows: View All Responses. Responses: 3 . Teacher tries to delete Required question #1 and gets warning "This will also delete the 4 response(s) already given to that question." (works as expected) Teacher tries to delete Non-Required question #2 and gets warning "This will also delete the 3 response(s) already given to that question." (works as expected). In brief, everything works as expected for me. Maybe the problem arises from the ambiguity of the word "response". Maybe we should revise its use and use the word "answer" for answer to an individual question, and reserve the word "response" for a complete response to a whole questionnaire. So instead of "Are you sure you want to delete the question at position 1 (aaa)? This will also delete the 4 response(s) already given to that question." we should have: "Are you sure you want to delete the question at position 1 (aaa)? This will also delete the 4 answer(s) already given to that question." Is that more clear? Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Counting responses
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, I think this is a misunderstanding about what the warning when you delete a question means.  I think this would be most clear. "Are you sure you want to delete the question at position 1 (aaa)?  This will also delete the 4 answer(s) already saved for that question (not all saved answers will be visible to you when you view responses for this questionnaire)" Perhaps the bit in brackets could go in a help popup?  Or maybe it is a little over the top?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Counting responses
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, Jenny, I'll think about the re-formulation. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Counting responses
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: obtaining datasets & graphs of questionnaire responses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I administered a questionnaire to students. I'm wondering how to see their response data in a table/graph form. I have viewed responses by clicking "View all responses" and "View by Response" but will Moodle generate charts & graphs to display this data? I would like to get breakdowns of each question. Can Moodle do this? Thank you! Emily

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: obtaining datasets & graphs of questionnaire responses
ResponsesInList.Text: The best way to generate exactly the kind of charts & graphs is to export your data ( Download as text format ) either to a spreadsheet such as Excel or to a more sophisticated stats package. Once your data is in the spreadsheet you can do what you want with it. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Unable to create new questionnaire from template
ResponsesInList.Text: We seem to be unable to create a new questionnaire from an existing template.  While we can edit the template, if we try to create a new questionnaire with that template, we receive an error message saying, "The survey does not exist". We are using Moodle 1.5.2.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to create new questionnaire from template
ResponsesInList.Text: We have the same problem (also using Moodle 1.5.2 + (2005060222) ). Despite the error message, copies of the template questionnaire are added to the list of template / public questionnaires to choose from every time you try to create a new questionnaire. Is there a way to delete these copy questionnaires? Markus

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to create new questionnaire from template
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Markus - If you use the latest version of the questionnaire module, available at the downloads page, that problem is fixed. Additionally, there is now a cron task that will clean up any 'orphaned' questionnaires. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to create new questionnaire from template - RESOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: The reason we were unable to create a new survey from a template was the presence of a single apostrophe (') in the "info" field of the template survey's entry in the questionnaire_survey table.  I went in and removed the apostrophe directly using phpMyAdmin and I can now create surveys using that template.  I suspect that other people who are getting the same error might have the same problem, and the same resolution should work for them. This resolution is really a workaround, though.  The insert_record function call in the survey_copy function in

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to create new questionnaire from template - RESOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: It is probably fixed in the latest version. You are using an older version. The latest one no longer has a 'phpESP' directory. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: How do I install the questionnaire or any Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Have recently installed moodle and want to add the questionnaire Module. I have downloaded it and placed the unzipped questionnaire folder into the directory where alll the other modules sit on the server . How then do I install the module?  As the module does not appear on our moodle site? Any help would be much appreciated CHeers

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I install the questionnaire or any Module
ResponsesInList.Text: After you have copied the files, you should have a folder called /mod/questionnaire which has all of the questionnaire files and subfolders. To install the module you will then need to go to the admin page (i.e. http://yourmoodlesite.com/admin/index.php ) and allow Moodle to setup the tables for the new module.

ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi I have the following error when I try to download in text format Error reading from database with the debug on: Error reading from database More information about this error Debug info: ERRO: tipos no UNION bigint e character varying não podem corresponder LINE 44: qrb.choice_id, null AS response, 0 AS ran... ^ SELECT qr.id || '_' || 'radiobuttons' || '_' || qrs.id AS id, qr.submitted, qr.complete, qr.grade, qr.username,
u.firstnamephonetic, u.lastnamephonetic, u.middlename, u.alternatename,
u.firstname, u.lastname, u.username, u.department, u.institution, u.id
as userid, qr.id AS rid, qrs.question_id, qrs.choice_id, qro.response, 0 AS rank FROM mdl_questionnaire_response qr JOIN mdl_questionnaire_resp_single qrs ON qrs.response_id = qr.id AND qr.survey_id = $1 AND qr.complete = $2 LEFT JOIN mdl_questionnaire_response_other qro ON qro.response_id = qr.id AND qro.choice_id = qrs.choice_id Stack trace: line 474 of /lib/dml/moodle_database.php: dml_read_exception thrown line 244 of /lib/dml/pg sql _native_moodle_database.php: call to moodle_database->query_end() line 753 of /lib/dml/pgsql_native_moodle_database.php: call to pgsql_native_moodle_database->query_end() line 2512 of /mod/questionnaire/questionnaire.class.php: call to pgsql_native_moodle_database->get_recordset_sql() line 2697 of /mod/questionnaire/questionnaire.class.php: call to questionnaire->get_survey_all_responses() line 490 of /mod/questionnaire/report.php: call to questionnaire->generate_csv() i´m using Moodle 3.1+ (Build: 20160526) and questionnaire 3.1.0 (Build - 2016052000) database is postgres , i ´m begining whith moodle I appreciate your help

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error reading from database - Download in text format
ResponsesInList.Text: It looks like something specific to Postgres... I believe the problem is that the "choice_id" column is a character type for the boolean response table and an integer for all others. Postgres doesn't like that. I have created issue CONTRIB-6436 for this bug. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error reading from database - Download in text format
ResponsesInList.Text: This has been fixed with the details in CONTRIB-6436 . For now, you can pull the latest from the MOODLE_31_STABLE branch, or apply the diff linked in the issue. When questionnaire release 3.1.2 comes out, the fix will be included. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error reading from database - Download in text format
ResponsesInList.Text: Fantastic!!! Thank you so much.

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire Module - Bug Fix
ResponsesInList.Text: I've updated the CVS to fix a bug in the questionnaire module, I've also included the file here for others. The existing module would mark a questionnaire as completed even if all required fields had not been completed. This resulted in an inconsistency between Moodle and phpESP, where Moodle thought the questionnaire was complete while phpESP did not. I also added Moodle logging of submittals. Grab it from CVS, or copy the attached files into your 'mod/questionnaire' directory. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic send notification for Questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello All, How can we send automatic notification to students regarding the questionnaire to remind them to fill it>

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic send notification for Questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: You can use the Moodle docs or other Moodle forum posts to research either of these options (or others), but these are two options that come to mind: 1 - Both Pulse and Reengagement are 3rd party plugins you can add to a course to remind users of an incomplete activity. 2 - A non-3rd party option is to consider enabling the "Upcoming Activities Due" model (in the Analytics ). Then, if you set a Timeline due date (at the very bottom of the Questionnaire settings) it will send out a weekly reminder of any upcoming activities that are not yet completed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire averages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey there, I have two instances of Moodle running (test site and live site) . Both sites have the same data, same plugin version [3.9.1 (Build - 2020111801)]. I am seeing differences in the averages for each question though. My scale is set to be a 1 to 5 scale but on my live site the averages go to 7, surpassing the maximum set. Settings are the same. Any ideas? Your help is greatly appreciated. Will

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire averages
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm only guessing, but I'm thinking that at one point the scale went higher than five, some responses were submitted with values higher than five, and then the scales was changed to a maximum of five. You can verify this by reviewing all the answers to see if any surpass five.

ResponsesInList.Title: Send choice text instead of value in email
ResponsesInList.Text: Just added a tracker item for this...( CONTRIB-1349 ) The email that is sent now when a response is submitted, sends the choice numeric value rather than the text. It would be nicer to receive the actual text of the choice instead. Modify this functionality to do this. *** Does this need to be a configurable option, or can we just set it to always send the text? *** This is a one line change if we don't need a configuration value. Does anyone actually need/use the numeric option? mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Send choice text instead of value in email
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess it would make sense for those responses to be sent with text values. After all numeric values are useful when response data is going to be processed in a spreadsheet or stats package, and obviously responses sent by e-mail are not meant to be thus processed. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Send choice text instead of value in email
ResponsesInList.Text: Done and comitted.

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple pages possible?
ResponsesInList.Text: The phpESP documentation suggests that you can put a survey on multiple pages by introducing a "section break" between questions, but I'm not sure what a section break is (is it just a horizontal rule?). The Moodle Questionnaire module includes a "section text" option to introduce text/HTML between questions; how could this possibly be used to create multiple pages in a survey? I have two reasons to use multiple pages: (a) not all my respondents answer the same questions, thus an alternative to branching (which I assume is not possible) could be to instruct them to scroll down to the bottom and click the submit button to continue, and (b) I would like to group thematically similar questions on the same page. If submission of multiple pages is not possible, I guess one could introduce HTML anchors in the section text to facilitate within-page links to help users navigate to appropriate sections . Thanks for your ideas -- Jim P.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple pages possible?
ResponsesInList.Text: Section text just adds text (be sure to put required on No or you block the questionnaire) You can add a section break with the reorder questions page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple pages possible?
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, that's easy enough! Thanks, Jim

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backup 1.5 -> 1.9 (a long shot but...)
ResponsesInList.Text: Did you find any resolution?  I am now going through this same issue. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backup 1.5 -> 1.9 (a long shot but...)
ResponsesInList.Text: There have been so many changes in the Questionnaire module between 1.5 and 1.9 that it is quite impossible to backup your questionnaires from 1.5 and restore them into 1.9. Normally one should upgrade one's Moodle from one major version to the next, in sequence. Sorry, but I'm afraid that re-creating your questionnaires in 1.9 is the only option left to you. I hope you will find the new interface in 1.9 much more user-friendly than in earlier versions, if that's a compensation. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Internationalization for manage_survey.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Angelo, There are several problems with the Portuguese (and Brazilian Portuguese) language files for the Questionnaire module (version 1.9). The latest questionnaire.php language file for English has 246 strings . pt_br_utf8 is very outdated and has only 138 strings and it is not UTF-8 but made with HTML entities, which is strange. pt_utf8 has only 216 strings There is a further complication, which we also had in the Spanish version. The same word is used to translate Quiz and Questionnaire. This is of course impossible and leads to confusion. For want of a better solution I have agreed with the Spanish translators to keep the English word Questionnaire. We should do the same in Portuguese, rather than having the word Questionários for both modules. I think there is a need for a Portuguese (and Brazilian) translator to revise the language files for those languages against the current English file. The names I have are for Brazil: Translated for : Luiz Paulo Leite Machado (lunixbr@gmail.com) // Date of translation : 2006/06/21 // Date of the last revision : 2006/07/12 // Translated for project Casa Brasil ( www.casabrasil.gov.br ) and for Portugal: antonio vilela (but he is no longer visiting this forum...) So Angelo, could you please contact a Brazilian and a Portuguese moodle translator and ask them to update the translations and contact me so I can update in CVS . Thank you, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Internationalization for manage_survey.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph, I will contact the translators, i would like to maintain the translation if possible.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Internationalization for manage_survey.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, please tell me how things progress. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Is anyone working on this module

With my installation - which is pretty standard (PHP, Apache , Moodle 1.5.x) - I find it very hard to construct a questionnaire. The flow of the the process is clunky and not at all intuitive. Worse though is that many of the actions lead to odd results or errors. Reorder questions goes nowhere. Trying to create a new field sometimes leads to an error page indicating that no survey exists. ResponsesInList.Title: Logging of Questionnaire respondent activity
ResponsesInList.Text: We are currently using the Questionnaire module (version 2014111004 on Moodle 2.8). Over the past few years, a colleague has been using the module for anonymous course feedback and to encourage feedback has given a prize to a randomly picked respondent  - they have previously been able to ascertain who has responded via the course participation report and course logs. (last year we were running version 2014041804 of the module on Moodle 2.6) and were able to make sure they didn't give the prize to someone who had not responded. It seems they are no longer able to access who has or has not responded via reports available through the UI. Does anyone know if there has been a change in what is logged by this module between versions 2014111004 & 2014041804 . If there hasn't been we will need to investigate if this change is due to a bug. I have seen some discussions regarding tightening up of anonymity but can't seem to find anything that tells me if changes in logging behaviour have been made to the module. Any help would be much appreciated. Rod

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Logging of Questionnaire respondent activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rod, You could set up activity completion on the questionnaire. In the questionnaire settings, set it that the activity is complete when a student has submitted the questionnaire.  That way, you can view the course's activity completion report to see who has or hasn't done the questionnaire. Catherine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Logging of Questionnaire respondent activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Catherine Thanks for this suggestion, it's a good idea - I'll pass it on to my colleagues. Rod

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Constant Sum question and Conditional branching
ResponsesInList.Text: I can't answer the first question, but conditional branching only works with questions that have single answers: "yes/no", "radio" and "dropdown" (see https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Questionnaire_Conditional_branching ). mike

ResponsesInList.Title: randomize items
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I would know if it is possible randomize items in the question. Thanks, bye Pamela

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: randomize items
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pam, So far as I know, Questionnaire does not support randomization of items in the question. And in this case, I am assume you mean randomize the order of the possible answers. If that is what you want, you might be able to achieve it by using a quiz and shuffle the answers to each question. If you mean to randomly pick which question to use, so far as I know questionnaire does not support that. Neither does the Feedback activity, however with it you can set it to alter which questions are shown based on a previous answer. Quiz does support randomly picking which questions to use. If you give an example of your question(s) we might be able to give a better/different answer.

ResponsesInList.Title: Could not create a new survey!
ResponsesInList.Text: When I try to create a questionnaire I get the error message "Could not create a new survey!" which I do not understand. I am the site admin, and I just got our site host to upgrade the Questionnaire module to 1.9 so it matches our Moodle version. Completely confused. Any ideas? Pete ( Edited by Joseph Rézeau - original submission Friday, 14 August 2009, 09:32 AM )

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire - you are not survey owner
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pete, Your problem seems related to your recent upgrade of the Questionnaire module. What happens is that when you try to create a new instance of Questionnaire, the Questionnaire module is unable to update your moodle database . Something must be wrong with that database, some fields may be missing. Can you tell us more about the story. Were you previously using a version 1.8 of Moodle (and of Questionnaire)? Did you a) upgrade from Moodle 1.8 to Moodle 1.9 and then upgrade from Questionnaire for moodle 1.8 to Questionnaire for moodle 1.9? After the Questionnaire for moodle 1.9 upgrade, did you, logged in as Admin, go to the front page of your moodle site and click on the Notifications link to update your moodle database? If not, can you do it now and see what happens? When you create a new questionnaire, instead of Create new, can you try Copy existing (supposing you have existing formerly created Questionnaires in that course)? Does it work? Which type of moodle database are you using ( mySql , MS- SQL or other?) If you had already created some questionnaires in your moodle site, do they still work? All the best, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: File Uploads within Questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Was wondering if anybody could help us out, we've looked around the forums but haven't been able to find a solution to our problem so thought we'd post it up here. We are looking for a way to streamline the existing assessment component within our Moodle platform, which currently consists of a combination of the " Upload Single File" acitivties and the Questionnaire Mod. As both of these activities handle assessment in different ways this makes grading overall student performance across the course a challenge. What we would ideally like to find is a Mod/Activity which is a hybrid of the two, combining the assessment side of the "Upload Single File" activity with the flexibilty of the Questionnaire Mod. The ideal solution would be to have the "Upload Single File" as a question type within the questionnaire, so that all the assessment is carried with it, however I've read in a number of places that this may not be possible? Is there any way of adding File Uploads to the Questionnaire Mod, or is there another way that we could achive this? Any ideas regarding possible Mods or solutions to this problem would be most gratefully recived,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: File Uploads within Questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rob, Are you sure you mean the Questionnaire activity, not the Quiz activity? Questionnaire belongs in the category of "survey-like" activities, which are used e.g. to gather people's opinions, etc. whereas the Quiz activity is typically used for assessment. If you are talking about the Questionnaire activity, then there is no "file upload" question type in it. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: File Uploads within Questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Thanks for getting back in touch. Altough we do use the Quiz activity for other elements of assesment, in this instance we were interested in the questionnaire mod. Specifically a way of incorperating the assessment elements into it. I realise that this is not what the activity was designed for, but we found the questionnaire easier to use under certain circumstances. Thanks again for the reply

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire Redirecting
Creating personality test with multiple scores of a single option
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am using Questionnaire add-on for 2.6 and it is awesome! I am trying to do the following, and I am wondering if there is a way to do it. If this has been asked before, I apologize, I couldn't find using the search, pointer to those threads will be much appreciated. I have about 30 questions. Some of them are multiple choice (one or more options correct) and others are rating type (1-5). I have 5-6 categories under which I want to report the score in (something like "quality of engagement, quality of workplace, short-term success, etc."). Each option in each question contributes a score to each of these categories (this part is different from 'personality test' included in Questionnaire where each score contributes to the score of the section). For example, if someone selects option A of Question 4, I want to say, add 1 to "Quality of Engagement", 2 to "Quality of workplace, and 5 to "short-term success". Thus I get aggregate for each category after completion by a student, which I then want to show in exactly the same way as 'personality test'. I am trying to see if this is possible to do, and if so how, in Questionnaire. If there is another way to model this question set so that it fits current 'personality test', I will appreciate those inputs too. Thanks in advance for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating personality test with multiple scores of a single option
ResponsesInList.Text: HI, As you have understood from the Questionnaire Personality Test feature documentation , what you are trying to do is not possible. You will have to rephrase your questionnaire questions in order to get the final result you want. I am pretty sure this is possible. It would help if you posted here the complete text and options of your sample "Question 4", so I can suggest how to rephrase them. You write " Some of [my questions] are multiple choice (one or more options correct) ... ". Please note that in survey-like activities such as Questionnaire, the notion of "correctness" does not exist . That activity is not meant to test a student's knowledge (as in Quiz or Lesson etc.) Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating personality test with multiple scores of a single option
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Joseph for quick response. You are right about the 'one or more are correct' phrase - I meant one or more are selected (there are no right or wrong). Here is an example question (somewhat changed from original, I am sorry it may sound a bit complicated) In my 1-1 with my manager, most of the time goes in discussing [select one or more] Project issues My career goals and interests Random topics No 1-1 I have 3 categories of behaviors that I am tracking about Manager's engagement with employee: Manager Engagement, Work Alignment, Career Alignment. If user selects option #1, I add 4 to "Work Alignment" and 0 to "Career Alignment", If #2, add 4 to "Career Alignment" and 0 to Work Alignment. For #3 and 4 0 for both. For #1 and #2, I will add 4 for Manager Engagement, and for #3 and 4, I will add 0 for Manager Engagement. Basically, I am trying to ask minimum number of questions and trying to track a few workplace behaviors, and each response actually tells about more than one such behaviors.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating personality test with multiple scores of a single option
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the details. Sorry I do not understand "No 1-1": is that "No" as "opposite of Yes" or as Number? I have no idea what it means anyway. I'm not too sure either about your use of "alignment" in that context . I'm afraid you will probably have to re-think the way your formulate your questions, maybe have more questions, in order to fit the "personality test" feature of Questionnaire. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating personality test with multiple scores of a single option
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry for being unclear, question and context is for a corporate setting where an employee has to have one-to-one meeting with his manager and get support for the work and for his career development. You are right: I will have to rethink my questions and break them further so that one answer is used to score only one category. Thanks for the help.
