ResponsesInList.Title: Question management
ResponsesInList.Text: Three questions and a couple of comments: Q1: Is it possible to undelete a question?  I deleted a couple by mistake -- I can see they are still in the database , with the delete field marked "Y".  I simply created them again, but I wonder if there is a way to undelete them. Q2: How do you delete a questionnaire file (item bank) that is no longer in use?  I see that the question file for a public questionnaire I deleted continues to show up as available for use when I create a new questionnaire.  Or have I overlooked something? Q3: If a text box appears as the first item in a questionnaire, it is backlighted yellow with a shadow frame and appears active.  But after a question of a different format, it is simply white with a plain border and appears inactive (even though it's active).  Is there a way around this so that all text boxes have the "active" appearance? Comments: If anyone else is wondering how to get NA in a ratings scale, it appears you set the "Precision" field non-zero (I don't know what it does for other types).  The "Length" field can be used to set the number of rating divisions (default=5).  It also sets the visible width of a text box, but I don't know what else it does.  Any further info on these two fields will be appreciated. Beware of "Use Public" if you want to create a different survey -- when it appears you are selecting a new file name on the "edit general" screen, you are simply renaming the old public file, and any changes you make are being made in the public source file.  You also apparently mess up of some of the links, since backup/restore fails.  But "Use Public" is a great tool if you want to have a standard format with limited privileges for most users (e.g., teacher evaluations by students). Thanks, Jim Robertson.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question management
ResponsesInList.Text: 1. Undeleting questions. There is no UI for this action, sorry. 2. Deleting questionnaires. Hmmm. If you delete a questionnaire, it should be gone. Or you deleting the instance if it that's using the Public Questionnaire, or the Public Questionnaire itself? 3. Text Box. I haven't seen this behaviour. Is it specific to any one theme? 4. Use Public. I'll have to look into the backup problems you mentioned. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question management
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, 1. Is there a simple way to undelete using the database (e.g., change the delete flag from Y to N and also do...)? 2. When I create a new questionnaire, the Use Public list contains one file (OldPublicXX_copy) that is not attached to any instance.  I think I copied a public (with new setting public), then aborted and returned directly to the couse without saving changes for the new (aborted) questionnaire. 3. I am using "default" as the theme.  Our site theme (Moodle 1.4.4) is based on OSX_White (downloaded) but the effect is the same for standard, standardwhite, and standardblue (tested just now).  You can see a similar effect on the Edit General page, where "Name" and "Email" have the "active" appearance, while "Title", "Subtitle", and "Confirmation" do not. 4. If you look into the backup/restore error, here is the full scenario FYI : I created Questionnaire #1 (Q1) as public.  I created Questionnaire #2 (Q2) and selected Q1 from the Use Public list, when I should have copied.  I went to Reorder Questions and selected Edit General, and changed the file name (thinking I was specifiying a new file).  Then I edited, added, and deleted questions and saved.  I also created other questionnaires using Copy and New Content. When reviewing I saw that Q1 and Q2 both use the same file, which I had modified (and renamed) into Q2 content.  Not understanding the problem, I tried a backup/restore (without user data).  Backup appeared successful, but I got an error on the restore (I don' recall what it said), which created 1 instance of each questionnaire but no attached content. I deleted the restored course.  I created Q1 again (New Content). I created another Q2 (Copy public).  I deleted the bogus Q1.  Old Q2 remained, but without content (the file had belonged to old Q1), so I deleted old Q2 also.  I didn't do anything to the others.  I tested Backup and restore -- I kept the default user settings on backup but restored without user data.  No errors, so I restored to the production site, also without error. Thanks, Jim.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question management
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it possible to undelete a question? Sorry to drag out an old question with a new answer (that's not related to Questionnaires but rather to Quizzes), but this question shows up high on the list in Google when I searched for Moodle Question Undelete. I have the problem using Moodle 2.7 (I explain after the answer). The deleted questions for me showed up as "old questions" in the quiz editing GUI (if you have checked " Also show old questions " in the GUI. You can get these questions back with a little creativity. Edit (gear icon) one of these "old questions", and inside the Editor, click the "Make copy" button. The new copy of the question won't be flagged as an "old question", so you have re-created the deleted question. It's not quite an un-delete (the "old question" remains), but at least you can move forward. Now for the context that got me here. I had for some unknown reason duplicated questions in many categories (perhaps by copying a course and/or importing questions from other courses, since we're not able to share the question banks easily). See my other various posts about that... While trying to delete the duplicates, I was informed by Moodle that it wasn't possible because the questions were in use in quizzes (they all had "*" next to them). However, later I saw that they actually were deleted (even though they show up now as "old questions"). The problem is that the quizzes that used these "old questions" are now broken, because they had random questions that drew from the category. My students got an error that there are not enough questions in the category, and the quiz fails.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question management
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Chris, I'm afraid you are mixing up two totally unrelated Moodle activities , Quiz (with its Questions bank) and Questionnaire (a 3rd-party add-on). If you still want to ask your question about "undeleting" or "deleting" questions from the Quiz questions bank I suggest re-posting to the relevant Quiz forum . After you've done that I'll delete your post from this Questionnaire forum in order to avoid causing further confusion. All the best, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire - Reporting/Graphs

I am currently being asked to scope out whether within Moodle we would be able to do a form of upward/360 degree feedback for learners - does anyone know if this is possible? Essentially we ask a range of students a whole host of questionns about themselves, and from the results we produce a graph which shows areas where they are stronger or weaker.  All this is done on a paper based system & the results later manipulated in excel & emailed to the person for storage on their own record. With the moodle questionnaire, is there anyway we could display a graph of results to screen on completion, so that the learner could immediately see feedback?  I know we could take the results from moodle & manipulate the data in excel, but this would mean an additional job for someone & a delay in getting the results.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire: export to CSV gives fatal error
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Craig, Looks to me like a server problem, not a Questionnaire problem. Anyway, which Moodle version are you on? What is the date of file mod/questionnaire/download.inc ? Is the first line : $Id: download.inc,v 1.3.10.1 2007/06/13 15:35:14 mchurch Exp $ ? If it's older, and maybe your other Questionnaire files are older too, you might try to dowload a more recent version (of the whole Questionnaire). How many questions does your questionnaire have? I expect it has 3725 respondents , not responses. Example: a questinnaire has 10 questions and has been answered by 20 people, this gives 20 respondents and 200 responses. Which is which in your case? Finally, you might e-mail me privately (see my profile) and attach your exported questionnaire with its data. I will treat it strictly confidentially, if this OK with your organization, of course. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire: export to CSV gives fatal error

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire: export to CSV gives fatal error
ResponsesInList.Text: In case anyone else has this issue, here is the FIX: 1.) Upgrade the mod to the latest version AND 2.) Change "max_execution_time" in apache file "php.ini". I changed it from the default of 30secs to 300secs.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to remove Questionnaire response report
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using Moodle 2.5.1+ and this question has to do with the report that is generated at the completion of a questionnaire. It shows all of the student's responses. My main hang-up is that there seems to be no option to link to the next activity, or at least back to course view. But also I need to know how to prevent students from being able to see their responses. Please don't ask me why we need to do this, because this is not a typical classroom situation. Anyway, once again, we don't want students to be able to see responses because we find it confusing and we just want students to be able to go back to the course page. I hope this makes sense to someone out there. Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to remove Questionnaire response report
ResponsesInList.Text: What you want is extremely easy. All you have to do is to set the student role's following permissions to Prevent : Read all responses any time, Read response summaries, subject to open times, Read own responses. You can do this either at site level or for each individual questionnaire. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to remove Questionnaire response report
ResponsesInList.Text: Joseph has already answered about hiding responses, so I'll just pick up on the link back to course view or the next activity. I would suggest that you go into the advanced settings for the questionnaire and put some suitable text in the "thank you" page to direct people wherever you want them to go after the survey is completed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to remove Questionnaire response report
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks to both of you. I changed the permissions on the Questionnaire from within permissions for students and it no longer shows the results/responses for the questionnaire. As far as a link back to the course, I don't think there are advanced settings for the questionnaire module since it is an add-on, or at least I can't find them. Inside the settings of each instance of the questionnaire there is nothing that lets you change the text. When the questionnaire is complete it says, "Continue". But actually none of this matters because since I got rid of the results/responses overview, it automatically takes the user back to the course screen. So thanks for helping me with this!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to remove Questionnaire response report
ResponsesInList.Text: While you're previewing the questionnaire (or indeed on any of it's pages), if you look in the admin block, you should see a questionnaire administration section. Within that section there is a link "advanced settings" to a url like /mod/questionnaire/qsettings.php?id=??? That's the page where you can change the "thank you" text.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to remove Questionnaire response report
ResponsesInList.Text: Okay, thanks! That is handy. For anyone reading this in the future who doesn't know, the admin block is the Administration block (it's on the left side in my theme). Once again, thank you both for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: People was asking me for a simple new feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Into the "Possible answers" field of a "Rate (scale 1..5)" question of the last release of questionnaire for Moodle 1.9, I had a list of sentences to rate. By downloading the submitted questionnaires in txt format, I had, as expected, a column for each sentence of this question with label: Qxx->{{Question Name}}->{{sentence yy}} A colleague asked me to have in the column header of the text file a nickname for each sentence. According to this request I changed the content of the "Possible answers" field of the "Rate (scale 1..5)" question from: sentence 1 sentence 2 sentence 3 .. to:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: People was asking me for a simple new feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Daniele >The same colleague asked, few days later, to have in the content of the columns just described of the exported text file, not the number of the radio button selected to rate the sentence but the label of the radio button... so I changed the content of the already described field from:... What you want to achieve (for your colleague) is not possible at the moment. Please remember that the goal of the rating question type is to rate responses along a scale, hence the use of numbers , not words! If your colleague wants to export the response data as text, then I suppose the aim is to process that data either ina a spreadsheet (e.g. Excel) or a statistical package. Those programs will want to use numbers to produce tables, statistics and graphs, not words. If your colleague needs to establish a table of equivalences between labels and numbers, she can do it easily in Excel or the stats package. I have spent a lot of time - in answer to Marija's request - to make the data exported by Questionnaire as straightforwardly useable as possible in a stats package and am certainly not going to change it now (unless you have strong arguments to convince me that it is needed). All the best, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: People was asking me for a simple new feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Joseph. Tomorrow morning I'll report your answer in the office. Up to now... thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Student Evaluations
ResponsesInList.Text: Has anyone done student evaluations of instructors using the questionnaire module yet? Our college uses a standardized survey for all courses to evaluate instructors. I was wondering I could conduct this survey in a secure, confidential manner for out moodle courses using the questionnaire module? I can think of two possible ways: Either create an "Evaluation Course" and enroll all students that are asked to evaluate courses into the evaluation course Add the survey into each course Option 2. seems to have the drawback that each instructor can "fiddle" with the survey parameters, like clicking the "Update Questionnaire" button, and change the "respondent type" from "fullname" to "anonymous," or change the open/closed dates, and in other ways affect the responses. Is there any way to prevent instructors from fiddling with the survey setup? Option 1 has the drawback that students need to login to another course to make the evaluation, and that one needs to makr an association between intructor and student so that students can't choose to evaluate an instructor of a course thet are not signed up for. I'm not sure how to do that. Any advice appreciated on how to conduct such surveys in a way that is confidential is appreciated. Thanks, Lars.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Evaluations
ResponsesInList.Text: Lars... We have been using phpESP for our student evaluations. We have a standard form that they use, and the department TechEd person sets them up (or I do). We have sent the link to the teacher and they have distributed it for the surveys. The teacher tells someone with permissions that the survey is complete, and then we print the results to pdf and send it to the instructor/Chair/whatever. In theory they have been able to "pack the ballot box" by taking the survey themselves since it allowed for multiple submissions. Being paranoid, I have sorted by IP address in an export to CSV, and I claim they are not being abused. We have just installed the questionnaire module, and I have moved the former surveys and templates into the Moodle module. I suspect that we will use the surveys in a very similar way. I will set up a survey and ask them to administer it. I need to see what the permissions are and how they work. Will they be able to access the results of any survey they can assign? It may be necessary for me to administratively set the survey up so that I can create the link to a survey "owned" by someone from the TechEd group? Here at least there is an incentive for teachers to get a fairly complete set of surveys. It is not "high stakes" for us in the eval process, and there would not be much incentive to fudge numbers. I guess I need to play with the new install. Regards...   Tom

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Evaluations
ResponsesInList.Text: Lars, First, let me thank Martin, Mike Churchward and phpESP for their efforts. We just did 15 sections , and it went very smoothly.  I used a method you didn't describe.  First, I created a separate questionnaire for each section by copying a template and renaming it  (This is actually quite quick, and if you want uncrackable confidentiality you could rename it with a long alpha-numeric name).  I then made a simple html page that contained a link to each questionnaire.  We brought our students into 3 labs at 5 different times.  These html pages were only made available for the 15 minutes or so that students were evaluating.  When the students left the rooms, we restarted the machines to erase any history (DeepFreeze installed).  IP addresses on the .csv files were double-checked to ensure that no extra questionnaires were submitted (you might not have static IP addresses). If you have any questions, let me know. Sincerely, Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: course satisfaction survey
ResponsesInList.Text: The questionnaire module can do that certainly, but it is a contributed module so you will have to enable it. The feedback module is present by default in Moodle 2 if you open its eye in Settings>Site admin>plugins

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: course satisfaction survey
ResponsesInList.Text: You don't mention what version of Moodle you're using? I can only speak for 1.9x.  If using the Questionnaire module you might decide to use a "Public" questionnaire.  What this does is have all results accumulate to the course from which the public questionnaire originated.  Instructors with access to that course would be the only ones able to view the results.  A download to text file, opened in Google Spreadsheets (or, Excel, if you have to) would tell you from which course each response originated and allow you to aggregate your results anyway you want.

ResponsesInList.Title: Announcing Moodle questionnaire release 3.7.0
ResponsesInList.Text:
This
release provides the first release of the Moodle Mobile questionnaire
app. The mobile app provides all completion functions of the web based
app, and allows individual review of completed questionnaires. It does
not include the feedback reporting options. While every effort has been taken to ensure correct operation on
mobile devices, this is the first release. If problems are discovered,
please report them at the Github repository ( https://github.com/PoetOS/moodle-mod_questionnaire ) or in the Moodle Tracker ( https://tracker.moodle.org/ ). Ideally a 'calendar selector' would be best, but a series of dropdowns as used in other parts of Moodle would suffice. Thanks v much, Craig

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using a date selector for the Date type field
ResponsesInList.Text: THat would be a welcome addtion. In the meantime is tere a way to adjust the date format? CUrrently it asks for dd/mm/yyyy I'd like to have it mm/dd/yyyy. How can I set that?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using a date selector for the Date type field
ResponsesInList.Text:
To adjust the date format for all of your questionnaires you can hack file mod/questionnaire/locallib.php line 25, change: 
```text
define('QUESTIONNAIREDATEFORMAT', '%d/%m/%Y');
```
 to 
```text
define('QUESTIONNAIREDATEFORMAT', '%m/%d/%Y');
```
 To check that it works, create a question of Date type in your questionnaire, go to "take the questionnaire" and next to the input field you will see, instead of the default example: (e.g. 21/4/2002) -> (e.g. 4/21/2002) . In my (forthcoming) proposal for a new version of Questionnaire, I have made this date formatting dependent on language files, so you will have e.g. 23/4/2007 in the English lang file, 23-4-2007 in the French file, 4/23/2007 in the US_English file, etc. Please note that at the moment there is not a very robust format checking for the Date question type in Questionnaire. If a respondent enters a response which does not correspond to the expected format, it will simply be ignored, the respondent will not receive a "wrong format" error message. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using a date selector for the Date type field
ResponsesInList.Text:
Joseph, Line 25 looks like this in the most recent version of Questionnaire: 
```text
define('QUESTIONNAIREDATEFORMAT', get_string('strfdate', 'questionnaire'));
```
 All our users are from the US, so I'd like to change it to %m/%d/%Y. It looks like the string format is determined in lang/en_utf8/questionnaire.php on line 180: 
```text
$string['strfdate'] = '%%d/%%m/%%Y';
```
 I'll try changing that, and the format hinting, lang/en_utf8/questionnaire.php on line 35: 
```text
$string['dateformatting'] = 'Use the day/month/year format, e.g. for today: ';
```
 ---Diana

The hinting is unaffected, and having searched the entire module, I can't even find " Use the day/month/year format" anywhere. I changed it to " Use the month / day /year format" but that is not showing. :perplexed:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: HTML coding in Label
ResponsesInList.Text:
Marija, Before displaying a "label" (sectiontext), its text is formatted as safe HTML . This is where the "radio button coding" is stripped out. You will find it in file questionnaire/questiontypes/questiontypes.class.php, in function sectiontext_survey_display($data) at line 1292. You might replace 
```text
format_text($this->content, FORMAT_HTML)
```
 with 
```text
$this->content
```
 and the radio-buttons, etc. that you want to display will be displayed. However, I don't think it's a good idea, for safety reasons. So I will certainly not change this in the regular distribution of the Questionnaire module. I would suggest another solution. Why don't you simply do a screenshot of the part of the questionnaire you want to "demonstrate" as an introduction and paste that screenshot into the text of your label? Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I am creating a tool in my institution's Moodle to enable staff to self-assess their ability to use Moodle and keep track of their progress in staff training sessions. I have drafted together some 'level descriptions' of five levels of user skill. I have started to create a questionnaire with Yes/No questions relating to these skills (each level on a separate page, with a label at the top of each page describing the level on that page). Questionnaire has done a very good job so far... however, after completing the self-assessment questionnaire for the first time, I would then like users to be able to revisit their responses and update as necessary. When I have tried returning to the questionnaire all the responses are blank and the user must complete the whole questionnaire again (i.e. once a user has selected 'Yes' for one of the skills, it is unnecessary for them to have to select 'Yes' again for that skill every time they repeat the self-assessment). Is there a way of achieving this? I.e. when a user returns to the questionnaire they start it with their previous responses already selected? Alternatively, would the Quiz tool be more suited to this? Thanks in advance, Dan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Have you taken a look at the database module. Easily done with this tool. Good luck, Randy Orwin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Randy, Thanks for your reply - I had not considered using the database tool, although I can imagine how that would be effective. I have limited experience with database, it would probably take me a while to create! If a better solution does not come up I might have a crack at that. Dan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Could you expand a bit on how you'd use database to achieve this? I've got an instructor at my organisation who is using interactive PDFs to accomplish this sort of self-assessment benchmarking and want to get him using Moodle to do it. I've just joined the organisation and they're on 1.97. We're moving to 2.1 in the coming months, but for this semester need to run on 1.9x. Thanks! KerryJ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Kerry, I would add a new database to my course and then create all of the appropriate fields that I want to use for the self assessment. You could use a yes/no format or you could use some kind of likert scale format to have them assess on a scale that could show improvement over time. I believe that there are two ways to look at subsequent assessments. One way is to just have each participant edit their original entry with a thought of printing the first entry so you can measure progress. The second way is to just have the participants do the assessment again (my preference). Now you have a record with a date of each assessment. When you create the template for the list view of the results, you can configure it in such a way that the participant will see all of their attempts in a table sorted by date, which will easily show progress and growth. You also have the option of turning on comments so the instructor could comment on progress etc... This kind of self assessment using the Database module works really well. You can find an example of this referenced in this post, http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=118496&parent=760485 . The sample database and data are still live. It is a bit different than what I have described but should give you an idea of how this process could work. Good Luck!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Randy! Will give it a whirl and let you know how I go. Cheers! KerryJ http://kerryj.com

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan, The kind of feature you want has been asked before in this forum and I have conducted several "experiments" towards that end. One "variety" of Questionnaire that I created was a kind of "portfolio", which allowed participants to enter data, save it and review it at will. However, this feature never made it to the "normal" distribution of Questionnaire. These discussions will show you how the question was discussed. As you may know (or not), there are plans to make a brand-new module in Moodle 2.1 (some time at the end of this year or more likely some time next year), called "Survey", which will incorporate the current features of the Survey, Feedback and Questionnaire modules combined, plus maybe some more features. See this documentation page: Development:Survey 2 brainstorm . Right now there is a kind of workaround to do what you want. If you set your questionnaire to "Save/Resume answers = Yes", then the participants can fill in their responses, save them, review them, save again etc. This works exactly like you want except that, once the participants have clicked the Submit button, they can no longer review/edit/save their responses. ATB Joseph PS You can contact me (at my email address in my profile) for any further help in this matter.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Questionnaire as a self-assessment tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph, Thanks for your reply and the relevant links. I had set "Save/Resume answers" to yes in the hope that each subsequent 'attempt' would build on the last, but, like you say, this goes away when the user clicks Submit. It's a shame the Portfolio Questionnaire didn't make it, I think it would be very useful. Perhaps I'll make do with the current situation and wait for Moodle 2.1! Dan

ResponsesInList.Title: Bug preventing numeric values from being saved...
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi In moodle/mod/questionnaire/questiontypes/questiontypes.class.php there is a bug that results in numeric responses not being saved in the database .  The bug is on line 238: 
```text
            $val = preg_replace("[/^0-9.\-]*(-?[0-9]*\.?[0-9]*).*/", '\1', $val);
```
 which should be: 
```text
            $val = preg_replace("/[^0-9.\-]*(-?[0-9]*\.?[0-9]*).*/", '\1', $val);
```
 That is, the first two characters of the regex have been transposed.  I don't think this has been fixed yet, but, if it has, apologies for the noise. Thanks. Later... Greg Oster

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bug preventing numeric values from being saved...
ResponsesInList.Text: @Greg, Thanks for your bug report. Actualy I noticed this bug myself 2 days ago and fixed it on the github repository see https://github.com/remotelearner/moodle-mod_questionnaire/commit/c36cdc75fe7c4fc8f47d4ee60b8a16ff2f73acab#questiontypes/questiontypes.class.php ATB Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Question Groups
ResponsesInList.Text: I am evaluating Moodle for it's suitability for a large corporate/management training application. I'm new to LMS, but experienced with PHP programming and development. In fact, it was nostalgic to see that Questionnaire is based on phpESP, a tool I used in a site about 8 years ago! The first step a user of our application will take will be the completion of a questionnaire/survey. The questionnaire is a series of rate-scale (values of 1 - 5) questions grouped into sub-scales. Each group of questions is tied to one management/supervision 'style' and each group consists of 6-8 questions distributed throughout the questionnaire. The questions belonging to a common group will be assessed together to compile a total score/rank/value for that group of questions. I don't see anything in the docs or forums about how to compose question 'groups'. Can anyone point me in the right direction?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question Groups
ResponsesInList.Text: Question groups do not exist in the Moodle Questionnaire module. If you absolutely need this feature and using software outside of Moodle is an option, then I recommend the excellent open source LimeSurvey . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Manager role forces a user to be a potential respondent on questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Apologies if this is a known issue, but in searching the forum and bug tracker I have not seen it mentioned... I've found that, on our installation, by giving a user account the "Manager" role (default configuration) at the system level, her account displays as a potential respondent in all questionnaires across the site (Moodle v. 2.7.1+, Build: 20140807 ; Questionnaire v 2.7.0, Build: 2014070401). This issue arose when a teacher sent a reminder (via questionnaire/show_nonrespondents.php ) to all of the non-respondents to an anonymous questionnaire, generating an email (Moodle internal messaging is disabled on our system) to the staff member with Manager role. The staff Manager is not "enrolled" with any role in the course in question. Given the questionnaire's anonymity, the teacher could not see the staff member as being on the list, but my subsequent testing on other questionnaires/courses with demo accounts confirms that apparently any account with the Manager-role appears as a potential respondent or non-respondent, as the case may be, regardless of the questionnaire or course. Further, clicking on the Manager user's name in the list of non-respondents generates a message confirming that the user is not enrolled in the course, rather than displaying the user profile. The Manager role is one our site rarely uses, so the problem for us is minor, but assuming the issue is not peculiar to our installation, it could be a bigger problem for others, if not a security issue (for example if one or more functions are mistakenly assessing user capabilities in assembling the non-respondents list for a questionnaire). It may also happen with other roles, as Manager is the only one I have tested. I hesitate to file a bug report, as this could be unique to our installation or just a boneheaded misunderstanding on my part. We've used Questionnaire with much satisfaction for years - many thanks to the developers who have provide it for us!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manager role forces a user to be a potential respondent on questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, Thanks for your interest in the Questionnaire plugin. If you do not want your Manager role to have anything to do with the Questionnaire instances in courses on your Moodle site, simply edit the Manager role and remove all permissions for Questionnaire. Site administration ► Users / ► Permissions ►Define roles Manager / Edit role / Filter: Questionnaire : uncheck ALL permissions. Joseph EDIT.- See also CONTRIB-5311 .

ResponsesInList.Title: Anonymous questionnaire (2.6) and List of responses etc.
ResponsesInList.Text: Further to my answer in this discussion here , I am contemplating some changes to the "anonymous" questionnaire behaviour (in version 2.6 and maybe porting back to 2.5). 1.- Up to version 2.4, the "List of (individual) responses"  was available to the teacher, through a navbar displaying only numbers. If the questionnaire was set to "anonymous", then each individual response was displayed with the heading "Respondent: - Anonymous". 2.- In version 2.5, that same "List of (individual) responses"  was available to the teacher, through a navbar displaying the names of the respondents. In an anonymous questionnnaire, in order to preserve anonymity, the "List of responses" link was simply removed from the tabs (and from the Questionnaire Administration bock). Now, considering the discussion mentioned above, I think that was perhaps not the best decision, and I am thinking of making the list of individual responses available again to the teacher, by displaying a list of links called "Response 1", "Response 2", etc. There may be situations when a teacher wants to view all "anonymized" individual responses to a questionnaire, I think. That is the system currently used by the Feedback plugin. 3.- Now, we need to examine the "Show non-respondents" feature. Since that feature became available (in 2.5), it is available to the teacher, for full-name as well as anonymous questionnaires. My view is that - even for an anonymous questionnaire - a teacher may want to check non-respondents in order to send them an email reminder. However, the availability of that feature may pose a problem with anonymity, as a teacher may deduce from the list of non-respondents the list of those who have responded, and even the identity in the case of one student only having responded. The Feedback plugin has taken the position to obviate this potential problem by removing the "show non-respondents" feature from anonymous feedbacks. Should I do the same with questionnaire? I'm waiting for your reactions, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anonymous questionnaire (2.6) and List of responses etc.
ResponsesInList.Text: 1 & 2.- Given the lack of reaction to this post, I have decided to restore the "View individual responses" list link for anonymous questionnaires. Of course the names of respondents are not displayed (nor the submission timestamp); the list is displayed "anonymized". Fixed and available on the github for Questionnaire versions 2.5 and 2.6. See CONTRIB-4785 . 3.- In order to retain for a teacher or tutor role the possibility to send reminder messages to the non-respondents, even to an anonymous questionnaire, this is my idea. On the Show nonrespondents page, just display the number of non-respondents together with one or 2 checkboxes. For a questionnaire with the Save option: ◊ started ◊ not started ... without the Save option: ◊ not submitted. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire 3.4.0 now available
ResponsesInList.Text:
A new release of questionnaire for the 3.4 branch is now available at the Moodle plugins database . This release includes two new features, provided with help from C. Jobst
and Y. Annanias of the University of Leipzig and the Online-Self-Assessment
project for the Faculty of Economics and Management Science, funded by the
EU/ESF (The European Social Fund in Germany). These features are: Multiple parent questions. Questions can now be dependent on multiple
question responses. Multiple feedback scoring. Questions can now be assigned to more than one
feedback section for personality test scoring. Details can be found in the release notes . While this release is intended for the 3.4 release branch of Moodle, it can also be installed in the 3.3 branch. Note that it changes the database structure and cannot be downgraded after installation. Please give it a try and provide any feedback through the forums or Github.

The assignment module is not suitable for our purpose because there are multiple questions. The quiz tool would meet this requirement but as it is geared towards assessment, it does not invite personal reflection. So the questionnaire was used. ResponsesInList.Title: New questionnaire releases
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all There are two new questionnaire releases in the plugins database : 4.4.0 supporting Moodle 4.4 and 4.5. 5.0.1 supporting Moodle 5.0 and 5.1. There is one significant new features provided by the OU: PR590 : Allow responses to be deleted automatically after a specified time. This is disabled by default. In a future release of the 5 branch, there will be a question recycle bin feature , also provided by the OU. This will allow deleted questions to be recovered, or finally deleted completely from the data tables. If anyone can try this out ahead of the release, and provide feedback on the PR or new issue, it will be appreciated. Additionally, the new default branch for new work is MOODLE_500_STABLE. All new work will be for Moodle 5 and up, with exceptions given for critical errors. Thanks to all who contributed to this effort.

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire shows only a blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: All of a sudden the questionnaire module only shows a blank page. Turning on debugging shows this error: Fatal error : Class 'questionnaire' not found in /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire/view.php on line 53 I don't see any error there. Any idea? Regards, Mitja

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire shows only a blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Mitja, Things rarely happen "all of a sudden" in the world of computers. Something must have happened on your Moodle site to explain this problem. Which version of moodle (and questionnaire) are you using? Have you recently upgraded either your moodle site or the questionnaire plugin?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire shows only a blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: I know that usually things don't "just happen" but this time I don't see other explanation. I was using questionnaire few days ago and now it doesn't work any more. In the meantime I didn't touch any file. Yesterday (after noticing the problem) I've replaced the questionnaire module with fresh version from moodle.org and also made CVS update to moodle core files. Nothing changed. I'm using Moodle 1.9.3 and the latest version of questionnaire for Moodle 1.9 If I want to view the questionnaire I get the above error, if I want to create new one I get this one: Fatal error : Class 'questionnaire' not found in /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire/mod_form.php on line 19 When I visit the admin page I get: Fatal error : Cannot redeclare questionnaire_upgrade() (previously declared in /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire/db/ mysql .php:3) in /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire.old/db/my sql .php on line 76

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire shows only a blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: Mitja > Fatal error : Cannot redeclare questionnaire_upgrade() (previously declared in /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire/db/ mysql .php:3) in /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire.old/db/my sql .php on line 76 Well, there should not be a /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire.old/ folder in your moodle installation! When you visit the admin page, your moodle thinks that you have installed a new module in the /mod/ folder, and it tries to install it, but of course it fails... Here is what you could try, to start from a clean start (remember to do a backup first if you have important data you want to save). Delete moodle/mod/questionnaire.old/ folder Go to Administration ► Modules ► Activities ► Manage activities and Delete the Questionnaire module. Immediately after that, completely delete /moodle/mod/questionnaire/ folder. Re-install the Questionnaire module in /moodle/mod/questionnaire/ folder. That should you start you from a clean installation. Hope that works, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire shows only a blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Joseph for your help. I guess that the replacing the questionnaire module folder with the fresh version, which I did before I asked for help here, did repair the problem. Unfortunately I forgot that I'm using a php cache (APC) which kept the problem in memory. Today, after clearing the cache, the module works again. Thanks again. Regards, Mitja

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire shows only a blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, fine. When I am developing I always find that caches are a nuisance and I try to turn them off as much as I can. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire shows only a blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: I had the same error: "If I want to view the questionnaire I get the above error, if I want to create new one I get this one: Fatal error : Class 'questionnaire' not found in /home/moodle/mod/questionnaire/mod_form.php on line 19" I fixed if by inserting this line at the start of questionnaire/mod_form.php: require_once($CFG-> dirroot .'/mod/questionnaire/locallib.php');

ResponsesInList.Title: Should the Questionnaire title default to empty?
ResponsesInList.Text:
I've run into an annoyance with questionnaire that I think can be fixed fairly easily. When duplicating a questionnaire it brings the name and title filled in already with the same value. So to change what the questionnaire is called, you have to change both values, on two different forms. The title is defaulting to the name, but it seems to actually copy the 'name' value to 'title'. A different approach would be to allow the title to be empty and default it to the name when it's used. For example, in the print_survey_start function there is a line: echo '

'.s($this->survey->title).'

'; that could be changed to echo '

'.s((strlen($this->survey->title)>0?$this->survey->title:$this->survey->name).'

'; You would also have to make the title field not a required field. This would solve the problem above such that unless you specified a custom title, you would only have to change the name to get it to display correctly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Should the Questionnaire title default to empty?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nate, Which versions of Moodle and Questionnaire are you using? Which method do you use to "duplicate" a questionnaire? Let's take an example, using Moodle 2.6 or latest 2.7. I have a questionnaire Named "Questionnaire 01" and entitled "Course evaluation". In Teacher Edit mode, I click the Edit link and, in the menu, I click the Duplicate link. Once my Questionnaire 01 has been duplicated, it is displayed in my course's list of activities under the same name, Questionnaire 01. So I click the little pen icon next to that name, and change this to Questionnaire 02. The title of the questionnaire remains unchanged ("Course evaluation"). You write "[...] to change what the questionnaire is called [...]". This is not clear, please refer to Name and Title, not "is called" which is ambiguous. I agree that it may seem unnecessary and confusing to have both a Name and a Title for a Questionnaire instance, but I do not quite understand why you see this as a problem. Please explain. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Should the Questionnaire title default to empty?
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry for leaving some holes.  We're currently using Moodle 2.6.3 and Questionnaire 2014041801.  We're using the duplicate function from the Edit dropdown. Here's our problem.  Our users don't generally have a difference between the name and the title.  In fact our support person didn't realize there was a title field.  When they first setup the Questionnaire and fill in the name, field, that value is copied to the title field in the database (automatically).  When they later come and duplicate the questionnaire and rename it, they need to go to both fields in order to rename it completely (which they haven't done because they didn't know the title field existed). I propose an alternative to copying the value of the name field to the title field when the questionnaire is created.  Allow the title field to be left blank and when displaying the title field, the plugin should check to see if the field has been given an explicit value and if not it should display the name field.  In this way, when users make a copy of the questionnaire without realizing there are two fields, they will only have to change the name of the Questionnaire once, in the name field, and the title field will inherit that value implicitly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Should the Questionnaire title default to empty?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the clarification, Nate. I have opened an issue in the tracker and might adopt your "fix" in a further version of Questionnaire. CONTRIB-5274 . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Should the Questionnaire title default to empty?
ResponsesInList.Text: After thinking this over, I've decided not to take any action. Indeed, when a Questionnaire instance is duplicated, it may be desirable to keep the same "title". Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Weekly Monthly, what's in a month?
ResponsesInList.Text: Questionnaire Module offers option to allow entry Daily, Weekly, Monthly. A casual user might wonder whether those date boundaries relate to our workweek calendar.  For example, Monthly=1 entry within the calendar month of October. I assume it works by subtracting the number of days since last entry in order to determine whether to allow a new entry, yes? Thus, for Monthly setting:  prevent entry if last-entry was less than 31days ago.  (32? 31? 30? 29?) for Weekly setting: prevent entry if last-entry was less than 8 (7?) days ago. for Daily setting: prevent entry if last-entry was less than 24 hours ago. Please confirm or correct my assumptions.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly Monthly, what's in a month?
ResponsesInList.Text: @Jeffrey, I really see no reason for misunderstanding the meaning of the "daily", "weekly" and "monthly" options. Your assumptions are correct. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly Monthly, what's weekly?
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there a way to get around this behavior? Let's assume the following example: In Moodle the week starts Monday. The start date of the Questinonair is a Tuesday, a student answeres on Wednesday, and the questionnair can be answered weekly (Questionnair 2.4). If I understood the previous entries correctly, the student is able to answer next Wednesday one minute after s/he did last week, not Monday one minute after midnight and not Tuesday one minute after the start date, isn't it? We run the questionnair every week to asses the weekly progress, and we would like that the Q. can be answered once between Mo-Su every week. It get's complicated to tell the students to always answer it exactly on Sunday. The only way around is to allow any number of answers and hope the students only answer once, or does weekly mean once between Mo-Su respectively between the start date + 7 days? Thanks, Kurt

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly Monthly, what's weekly?
ResponsesInList.Text: "Once a week" means once every 7 days . For example, if a student answers a questionnaire on Wednesday, August 4th at 9am, they cannot answer it again before Wednesday, August 11th at 9am. However, nothing forces them to answer the questionnaire again after that 7-day interval. This has nothing to do with what you call a "Moodle week". In the (to be released) version 2.5 of Questionnaire there is a useful feature of "show non-respondents" which allows teachers (or admins) to send an email reminder to students who have not yet responded to a questionnaire. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly Monthly, what's weekly?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your answer. Are you sure that this is the case? I just tested it, and with "answer weekly" selected, I ansered the questionnair on Tu, 27.8 at 9:39 and again on Mo, 2.9 at 9:45 which should not be possible if what you say is correct because it is less than 7 days difference. I was adding Groups to the course, so maybe the counting got confused because I was changing the settings, or is Questionnair using a "Moodle week"? Kurt

ResponsesInList.Title: Getting parents to fill out a questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: I have made questionnaire's for the whole school, however the school would like parents to take these as-well, is there any way possible to send the questionnaire out in an email, or in a link, or anything like that. Thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Getting parents to fill out a questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: yes - we do that - you just email them the URL of your questionnaire and then they can click on it to fill it in. However... assuming you don't have hundreds of parents logged in to your Moodle site, the questionnaire will need to have its permissions altered to allow guests to fill it in. (Alternatively there is the feedback module, a non-standard module, which allows non-logged in users to complete it)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Getting parents to fill out a questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: Oh ok thank you, and how would you go about doing either of those? Your help is greatly appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Getting parents to fill out a questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: Well you'll need to make your questionnaire on a course that is open to guest access -the front page would be best if it is for parents. Then (assuming you have permissions to "override permissions" -if you are admin you wil; if you are a "teacher" you won't) then click on the questionnaire and "update this questionnaire" Click on the override permissions tab and select guest. Then make complete and submit a questionnaire and view a questionnaire "allow" and save the changes. You will also need to set your questionnaire to respond many - and anonymous in the settings of the questionnaire.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Getting parents to fill out a questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jonathan, I suppose that questionnaire is set as anonymous. I also suppose the parents are not enroled in any course on your school's moodle site. If so, then I would suggest not using a moodle module (feedback or questionnaire) for your survey, but an independent survey such as the excellent open source LimeSurvey . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Possible Answers Disappear

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire grading incorrect
ResponsesInList.Text:
I currently have a bug that is making my Gradebook inaccurate for the Questionnaire responses. some people have Questionnaire responses that are tracked as
having a grade of 0, even though they were submitted, and other people have
responses that are submitted, but have a grade. Here is the data from the relevant table, the
mdl_questionnaire_response table. I added in sample student's names for readability. (name) id survey_id submitted complete grade username Student1 721 9 1288297509 y 0 732 Student2 9172 9 1392319514 y 100 679 See how Student1 has a grade of 0 in the grade column, but
complete is marked as "y”. I believe this is the case for all the students that
are showing up as inaccurate data. I am using Questionnaire version 20101101022.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire grading incorrect
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Evan, 1.- 20101101022 looks like a pretty old version of Questionnaire. What about upgrading to a more current version? And which version of Moodle are you using? 2.- As usual, the problem you are describing is typical of something that is impossible to replicate on installations other than yours, especially since "sometimes it happens" and "sometimes it doesn't". I suggest you investigate (by looking at your Moodle database ) and try to find out which event leads to the "grade" being sometimes 0 and sometimes 100. All the best, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire grading incorrect
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't know why it says that we are on such an old version of Questionnaire; I thought it had been updated more recently than that, but that is what the plugins screen said. We are on Moodle 2.6.x. I could try upgrading Questionnaire, but I'm not sure if that would fix the problem for the existing faulty records. At this point, all I can say is that some people have taken the questionnaire and it's assigned them the proper grade, and others have not gotten it assigned. I don't know how to determine what circumstances trigger this. It is a fairly old install of Moodle that has been upgraded over the years, so it is possible that it could be some of the legacy questionnaires that were added years ago behave erratically. Can you just confirm though that if you set a questionnaire to give people a grade of 100 on completion then a grade of 100 should show in the grade table every time a questionnaire is submitted? That way, I at least know that this is a bug and not some sort of feature that I misunderstand.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire grading incorrect
ResponsesInList.Text: If you are using Moodle 2.6 then I recommend upgrading your Questionnaire to current version for 2.6 (see the Moodle plugins repository). I cannot guarantee that upgrading would solve your problem, however. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Upgrading to Questionnaire 2.9 introduced problems in database schema
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, When i upgraded my Moodle 2.7 to Moodle 2.9, i also updated my questionnaire module. And after that, when i launch php admin/cli/check_database_schema.php i see this : ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- questionnaire_survey * column 'feedbackscores' should be NOT NULL (I) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- questionnaire_feedback * column 'feedbacklabel' length is 30, expected 50 (C) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- It seems something was not well handled when upgrading... Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading to Questionnaire 2.9 introduced problems in database schema
Re: Upgrading to Questionnaire 2.9 introduced problems in database schema
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Indeed there is a mismatch in the plugin upgrade, If you install the Questionnaire for the first time then the 'feedbackscores' column is created correctly- and doesn't allow nulls. (It is created using the Install. xml ) Though, if you upgrade it from an older version, then the column is created in the upgrade.php file and it allows null values. This caused us a problem when trying to restore courses from a different site that upgraded the Questionnaire to a site that had a clean installation of the same version, the null values couldn't be inserted on the clean installation. that were inserted in the first site. This should really be fixed in the Questionnaire. Y Z Developer in OpenApp

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading to Questionnaire 2.9 introduced problems in database schema
ResponsesInList.Text: Best way to deal with these is to create an issue in the tracker. I have created CONTRIB-6445 for this issue. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire export/import
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am trying to find if questionnaire module could export/import questions ( I mean questions not answers and I know that feedback does). I am just asking because the version I have do not allow this and I am not able to find the answer in documentation or here in the forum. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire export/import
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Miro, No, at the moment the Questionnaire module cannot export/import questions. The reason is that the questions are "attached" to a specific instance of Questionnaire. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire export/import
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph, thank you for prompt replay.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire export/import
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it still the case that the Questionnaire module for Moodle 1.9 can't export the questions to another site or course? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire export/import
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul, Questionnaire cannot export/import its questions. However, it's easy to create a template questionnaire and create another questionnaire based on that template, using all or some of the original questions or editing them. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire export/import
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Joseph, we'll have a look at that.

ResponsesInList.Title: restoring public questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a number of courses that use the same questionnaire. So, I created a new hidden course and created a public questionnaire in it. When I create a course and add a questionnaire I chose the correct one from the list. This way all my responses are recorded in one area. All good. When I Backup a course that has questionnaires (that responses are recorded in the hidden course) and Restore them, the questionnaires are themselves Public, therefore I have more than one Public questionnaire. Is there a way around this? Apologies for a long a complicated post!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: restoring public questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: That's an interesting case. I will have a look into it and post my remarks here. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: restoring public questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Joseph. I've tested this myself and the list of public questionnaires increased. I'm using Moodle 1.9. Ed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: restoring public questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: After consultation with Mike Churchward, we are aware of this problem but cannot do anything about it. The "public questionnaire" feature is very complicated as it exists, and any tampering with it might have serious consequences, especially for security issues. The advice we can give is that questionnaires which are based on a "public" one should not be backed-up and restored. ATB Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: The course does not exist error
ResponsesInList.Text: We have a Moodle installation which was upgraded to Moddle 1.6 and is currently running v1.6.2 We have just discovered that whenever we attempt to create a Questionnaire the whole process appears to go just fine until the final Save & Exit option. At this point we receive a terse message that 'The course does not exist' and the Questionnaire is not created. We can reproduce this with new questionnaires AND questionnaires created using a template. Can anyone offer a suggestion as to how to fix this issue? I suspect that this has only arisen since the upgrade to Moodle 1.6.* Since we haven't needed a questionnaire for a month or two. Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: [Resolved]: The course does not exist error
ResponsesInList.Text: Hate to answer my own questions... but since I seem to have a solution I thought it would be worthwhile to post the resolution... I had three separate Moodle installations. All had the same problem with respect to getting the 'This Course does not exist' error when creating new questionnaires or from templates. I upgraded to Moodle 1.6.3 which did not resolve the issue. I then removed the Questionnaire module then reinstalled it. That not only fixed the creation error but also revealed that the module was not correctly installed. The set up screens for a Questionnaire are now easier to read and are more explanatory. It appeared that this issue arose after upgrading to Moodle 1.6 so, perhaps, the ugrade affected something. The fix has worked with two of the three sites. I'm having to backup more data before attempting to fix the third site. But I see no reason to think it won't work just as well. Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [Resolved]: The course does not exist error
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for answering your own question!!  You were a lifesaver, because we, too, were having issues with our questionnaire module.  Removing it and reinstalling it was the answer for us also! Thanks!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Rate data not saved in CSV export file
ResponsesInList.Text:
Does anyone know a workaround for this problem? I have a questionnaire in which I have used the 'Rate (scale 1 ..5)'
Type question. Some 250 students have answered the questionnaire and all
the results appear within the Moodle interface. However, when I export
the results as a CSV file the results for the items that used the 'Rate
(scale 1 ..5)' Type question are wrong. There are two versions of this problem: On my production site I am using Moodle 1.4.3, and Questionnaire Module
version 2005030101. In this case all of the item names appear in the
top row of the CSV file, but all of the results for the 'Rate
(scale 1 ..5)' Type are missing. On my experimental site I am using Moodle 1.5, and Questionnaire Module
version 2005062701. With this set up, only the result of the last 'Rate
(scale 1 ..5)' Type is reported. What is more, the reported results is
one less (minus 1) than the actual number chosen. Having
done a search for 'CSV export' within the Questionnaire forum, it seems
that I am not the only Moodler to have experienced this problem. For
example see Peter Noelle's posting , and Alex Walker's posting . I realise that for any future questionnaires I make, the solution
will be to use another item type (e.g. radio buttons), however is there
anyway that I can extract the results for the 'Rate
(scale 1 ..5)' Type items in the questionnaire that has already
been answerd by 250 students on my production site . I had the results
sent to my email, so it may be possible for me to convert these 250
emails into a CSV file, however, if anyone knows a simpler solution, I'd
much appeciate your advice. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire Submission Notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a number of courses on my site that use questionnaires to collect evaluation or demographic information from participants.  They have implemented the "advanced" feature to send notifications upon submission to specified email addresses.  This has been working well until our hosting provider upgraded our site from version 2.5 to 2.6.2 late last week.  Now these notifications are no longer arriving at those specified email addresses.  Other automated email notifications (e.g., assignment submissions) appear to be working.  The build number on our questionnaire module is 2014010900. I need to do some more testing, but I think notifications of certificates going to "others" is also not working.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire Submission Notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Larry, There have been no changes to the "submission notifications" feature between questionnaire versions 2.5 and 2.6.  Are you sure the submission email addresses are still there in your questionnaire's Advanced Settings Submission options? Try to switch on the Debug email sending option in      Site administration ► Development ► Debugging and check that the SMTP verbose details are OK (or not). Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire Submission Notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: Joseph, thanks for your response. Yes, the addresses are still there and accurate.  I also created a new questionnaire in a sandbox course and included what I knew were two good addresses.  Four tests of submissions of that questionnaire failed to generate email notifications. I had thought that this problem also existed in the certificate module, but I was incorrect about that.  I just did a test of the ability to send notifications of certificate issues to both the teachers and to an "other" address that was not a teacher. Notifications to both teachers and to the "other" address were received almost immediately upon the creation of that certificate--evidence that the site is processing emails quickly. I turned on the smtp debug for awhile when doing these tests, but they did not generate any errors. Any other suggestions? While I use a hosted service for Moodle, I'm glad to share anything you suggest with that service.

ResponsesInList.Title: Non-Respondent email sent to users not enrolled in course
ResponsesInList.Text: Using version 2014010301 some of our support staff with roles assigned at the site have received emails that are clearly intended for students.  When asked, the prof said she was using the Non Respondents user list to send an email to all users who hadn't responded yet reminding them to do so.  When I looked into the matter I discovered the questionnaire_get_incomplete_users is using the get_users_by_capability function, which doesn't check enrolled status. When I updated questionnaire_get_incomplete_users to instead use the get_enrolled_users function, everything works as expected again. I've attached a patch file with the fix. We're using Moodle 2.6, but when I checked the latest version of Questionnaire at Github I noticed the offending code is still in place.

ResponsesInList.Title: Classroom course evalation
ResponsesInList.Text: My company is giving a number of three or four day classroom courses. We have been using regular paper evaluations but would like to see if it is possible use the Questionnaire module of our Moodle system for this. Each student has a PC on which we could add a link to moodle. Has anyone implemented something like this? Do I have to create a new course containing only the questionnaire? Any suggestions are welcome. Thanks, Thomas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Classroom course evalation
ResponsesInList.Text: I have done this since 2006 with the questionaire module.  If you are not doing a blended course, you need to make a course. We run a F2F semester long program with 30 to 100 evaluations.  We have two standard evals.  One for academic subjects and one for each food service week. We also put PDFs and exams  in the Moodle course.  When the course repeats, we use a backup of the old without student data and restore it to a new course. We also have 3 or 4 day F2F courses, that may run once or twice a year.  We use the same course, copy the old eval activity and give it a new name (add a date like Spring 2017) so when we do a summary we see the date.    Ditto with the exam. We hide the old eval and exam,  We change the password to get into the course. Hope those two ideas help you figure out a system that works for you.  You could also add a certificate using the same techniques. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is there a problem in the github
ResponsesInList.Text: After downloading from the github you must switch to the branch you want. The "master" branch is purposefully kept empty. On a production server , switch to MOODLE_24_STABLE branch if your site is using moodle 2.4 or 2.5. Do NOT switch to the MOODLE_25_STABLE branch on a production server, because it has not yet been thoroughly tested. If you want to help, you are welcome to test the MOODLE_25_STABLE branch on a test server and report any bugs, remarks, etc. in this forum and in the bug tracker. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Input font size
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Phil, Add the following CSS rule at the end of your current Questionnaire css stylesheet (default.css ?): .qnType input[type="text"] { font-family:Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; /*if you want*/ font-size:1.2em; /*put here the size you want*/ font-weight:bold; /*if you want*/ } Notice that you can change not only the font-size but other settings as well, according to your needs. Joseph EDIT.- This will work in recent versions of MSIE and FF ; it probably won't work in MSIE previous to version 7.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 1.9 and Postgresql Install errors
ResponsesInList.Text: Jonathan - I am assuming that you are doing a fresh install. If (and only if) that is the case you may want to use phppgadmin or some other tool (even the pg command prompt) to drop the tables; however, if you are upgrading and already have data in those tables obviously you do not want to drop them. I dropped them because I wanted to get a fresh install to work. After dropping the tables I used a text edit to change line 45 of the /mod/questionnaire/db/install. xml file to read: <FIELD NAME="changed" TYPE="datetime" NOTNULL="false" SEQUENCE="false" ENUM="false" PREVIOUS="thank_body"/> Essentially I just removed the DEFAULT="0" part of that line since that was what was causing the problem. I also created an issue - CONTRIB-343 to alert the maintainer of this issue. Thanks for bringing this to our attention and let me know if you have any other problems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 1.9 and Postgresql Install errors
ResponsesInList.Text: That did it. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 1.9 and Postgresql Install errors

Unfortunately this means I've been unable to test Gareth's work to update the module to use roles & capabilities instead of the old isguest() functions, so that's having to go on hold until Mike can (please??) sort out the database issues for Postgres.

ResponsesInList.Title: Response visibility permission
ResponsesInList.Text: I need help in designing a rate(scale) survey. These are the 3 areas I am looking for some possible solutions: 1. After the response to every question in the survey has been submitted, I want that student to see his response as well as responses of all other students who have taken that survey. Right now only a student can only view his responses. 2. Secondly, while the student is viewing his and other students' responses, during this time I also want him to write his reasons for choosing a particular response. 3. Once the student has submitted his reasons as well, this time I wanted to show him all the reasons he gave along with the reasons given by the other students. Kindly suggest, if it is possible to achieve above scenarios using some settings in the questionnaire module. Many thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Response visibility permission
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Rajinder, #1. It is quite possible to allow a student to view other students' individual responses, by setting the necessary permissions in the questionnaire settings. #2 and #3 are not possible and I do not really understand what you want to do. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Response visibility permission
ResponsesInList.Text: Regarding #2 and 3, it sounds like you would need 2 questionnaires  to make this happen. Let the first questionnaire cover the first survey. Students are given permission to view other students' responses. Create a second questionnaire to capture the reasons why the student chose his responses. Create a way that the student can get to the second questionnaire while viewing the responses of the first one. (A block with the link to the second questionnaire might work. The link could be forced to open in a new window/tab so the student could still view the responses.) This is what I would do if it's necessary for the student to view the responses before giving his reasons. If it's not, why not ask the student to give his reasons in the first questionnaire? That way the student will be able to see the responses and the reasons of his fellow students after he finishes his questionnaire. I hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Linking Questionnaire to an Activity (certificate)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I would like to link a questionnaire to an activity (specifically a certificate- using the certificate plugin).  I am using moodle 1.9, and by default there is no link-to option for the questionnaire.  The course I'm creating is very simple and does not have any grades, but I would like to make completion of the end of course questionnaire a condition for showing the certificate, and preferrably directly link to it.  One idea I have is to set "submission grade" for the questionnaire to "100" and then in the certificate settings, make "course grade, condition=yes, 100".  I could then perhaps make a lesson that is "certificate gateway" with a simple "did you take the questionnaire" question, with a 100 score with yes answer, and a link to the certificate from there. My questions are:  1.  Will the above strategy work?  2.  Is there a simpler way to accompish this (ie: make completion of the questionnaire the condition for showing the certificate, and link directly to it upon completion)? Thanks so much for any suggestions you can give!

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire Bug Fixes
ResponsesInList.Text: I've found a bug in Questionnaire which I've fixed. I'm not sure where to post it so I'll just pop it here if thats OK. The bug occurs with IIS 6 and PHP 5 in the locallib.php file I have modified line 293 to wrap string based object property references with curly brackets - e.g. "view.php?id={$this->cm->id}" add_to_log($this->course->id, "questionnaire", "submit", "view.php?id={$this->cm->id}", "{$this->id}", $this->cm->id, $USER->id); Without this the code terminates (not sure what the error message would be because we have error display = off and I haven't set a log location.) Also, I'm not sure why the original script encapsulates $this->id in double quotes ("$this->id" ) - cant it just be $this->id ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Disable "Previous" button
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there; I'm a longtime user of this great plugin for various research projects, etc. This time, however, I need to ensure that respondents cannot move backward through the instrument. I can't see anywhere to suppress the "previous" button as can be done in the Quiz module. I'd prefer to use Questionnaire, though, because it can be configured to require an answer before continuing, which is most important for the informed consent page at the beginning. If I do that with the Quiz module, it's possible to just skip it! Is there any way to suppress that button? Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Disable "Previous" button
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Aaron and thanks for your appreciation of the Questionnaire plugin. In your message you compare the features/merits of the Quiz and the Questionnaire plugins, which I do not understand, since those two plugins have totally different goals . Sorry, there is no way to prevent the respondent from moving backwards through Questionnaire pages. And I do not see a good reason for preventing that navigation. However, what about putting all your Questionnaire questions on a single page? If you really need this feature and are willing to hack your Questionnaire files, then there is an easy solution. In version 2.7 of Questionnaire, in the yourmoodle/mod/questionnaire/questionnaire.class.php file, simply comment out line 665: //echo '<input type="submit" name="prev" value="<< '.get_string('previouspage', 'questionnaire').'" />'; Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Disable "Previous" button
ResponsesInList.Text:
Thanks for the quick reply! First off, thank you for the code; that will probably do the trick. Secondly,
as for your question: For my research, either Questionnaire or Quiz
will work fine. In my classes, I use Questionnaire for...
questionnaires, because it blows the default plugin out of the water. I
use quizzes in my classes for graded quizzes. However, for my research, the only thing I actually need is the ability to download the responses. In the present study, they will be presented with a question, then they will watch a video, then they will be presented with the question and multiple choice options. As long as something can present that info and let the respondent pick answers, I'm good to go. I have typically used Questionnaire for research like this; however, I could also use Quiz. Actually, a lot of people use Questionnaire for assessment research; it's versatile and straightforward and easy to get your data out when you're ready. I'm pretty sure I'm the only one using Questionnaire on this server ... I bet I could get away with "breaking" it while I'm doing this study...

ResponsesInList.Title: Help pop-ups for questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text:
I posted something about this subject on the general forum but it clearly has more relevance here. I think It would be desirable in the phpESP questionnaire to have a proper "add help item" option in the phpESP admin interface . Adding a help icon to a question is a fairly
straightforward hack but the task becomes tedious when adding a help icon to a number
of options under one question (e.g. list of check boxes or radio buttons). In terms of usability , I think it is much clearer if there is a minimum of instructions in the survey, but a help button if people want to ask for clarification. We did a rather imperfect hack in question 14 in the covcell survey .  It would be interesting to know if someone has already done
this, or feels the need for such a feature. The help texts were not translated but they were provided for with sets of help files for each language. A couple of years ago we also did some work (i.e. it was partly done) on answering questions on images, but that may have been lost in a server crash. I can check it out if there are some potential collaborators out there. brgds Paul

ResponsesInList.Text: I'm trying to backup courses from Moodle 2.8.8 (Questionnaire 2014111004) and restore to Moodle 3.1 (Questionnaire 2016020203). ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate Questionnaire Activity (Moodle 2.8.8 > Moodle 3.1)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Peter - I believe that "should" work. Any chance you could provide me a copy of the backup file that is failing so I can test and see where the problem might be? mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate Questionnaire Activity (Moodle 2.8.8 > Moodle 3.1)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, Thanks for your reply, I've found an easier solution, on closer look I found the problem was due to an attempt to insert a null value in the mdl_questionnaire_survey table > feebackscores column. The column is set to "not null" and has a default value of '0' but the null constraint was still raising an error due to the code explicitly inserting a null value. For now I have allowed null values for the column. We are in the middle of migrating approx. 4,500 courses from Moodle 2.8.8 to a new 3.1 instance, after the migration is complete I will reapply the null constraint. Once again many thanks for your reply.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire

Guests can of course see "their" results, but since Moodle treats guests as a single person, the results they see are aggregation of all guest answers.
