ResponsesInList.Title: View All Responses Security Issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Setting Students can view ALL responses to NEVER does not prevent students from accessing the View All Responses report of a questionnaire. The setting seems to only remove the hyperlink from the student role and not prevent access. This is a big security issue since, under certain scenarios, a student could easily figure out how to access the view all responses report without that hyperlink. One example is if a course uses 2 types of questionnaires where 1 questionnaire View all responses is set to never and another questionnaire where View all responses is set to visible. It wouldn't take much for a student to figure out that changing the instance parameter from the questionnaire where view all responses is visible will take you to another questionnaire and the View all set to never will not restrict the student from viewing the report. The security problem was first reported back in 2011 here https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=166492 .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: View All Responses Security Issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Question - was the setting changed to "never" before or after a student submitted a response? I did a test on my 3.5 system -- I created a questionnaire, set the View all Responses setting to 'Never,' and then logged in as a sample student to submit  a response. There was no "view all" link, but when I attempted to use the teacher URL see the "view all" (when logged in as a test student), and i got the message that I dont have the permission to View all responses. However, in a separate test, I created the another questionnaire, left the View all Responses setting set to 'immediately after submission', then I submitted a  response as a test student , then I logged in as the teacher and changed the "view all" setting to "Never". When I logged back in as a student, that "Never" setting was not respected -- the test student could still see and view the responses with the teacher URL as you have noted.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: View All Responses Security Issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John, I investigated this a little more and I was able to replicate your first test and got the same result with the Don't have permission to view all responses message. However it seems that the reason you got a different result on your second test is that you submitted a response. To test this I created a brand new questionnaire from a template with the View all responses set to N ever from the get go. These are the steps I took: I made a submission with Student A -- -> Then I logged in as Student B and pasted the view all link copied from teacher's role and I got the permission error you described -- -> I then made a submission with Student B and pasted the same view all link that gave me a permission error but this time I got through and could see all responses. The only variable from getting a permission error and getting through to view the View all report was that I made a submission. For now the only way to prevent this seems to manually set the role permissions for each questionnaire to prevent viewing all responses from the student role.

ResponsesInList.Title: Diagnostic tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I am looking into the feasibility of creating a diagnostic questionnaire in Moodle. I would need: 1. An online questionnaire with approximately 25 questions. The questions are multiple choice with scaled answers (1-4). 2. Person A would complete the questionnaire about themselves. 3. Approximately six other people would then answer the same questions about person A. 4. All the data / responses would need to be private. 5. Ideally I would like to generate a report comparing person A's responses against the average of the other peoples' responses. 6. Could the statistics be exportable to Excel? 7. Could I set Moodle to send invitation, reminder, completion emails to respondents and progress report emails to be sent to me? 8. Can I brand the questionnaire? 9. If the above is possible, I would need to use the questionnaire for fairly large numbers, say 100 x person A. Is there a maximum number of times, respondents for this sort of activity? Please could you let me know if the above is possible? Thanks in anticipation. Di

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Diagnostic tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Di, 1. An online questionnaire with approximately 25 questions. The questions are multiple choice with scaled answers (1-4). OK 2. Person A would complete the questionnaire about themselves. OK 3. Approximately six other people would then answer the same questions about person A. OK 4. All the data / responses would need to be private. I suppose you mean that respondents B, C...G would know - of course - that they are answering questions about person A, but person A would not know how those 6 other respondents have answered. Yes, that is possible. 5. Ideally I would like to generate a report comparing person A's responses against the average of the other peoples' responses. 6. Could the statistics be exportable to Excel? Well, you could export all the responses as text/csv and process the data in Excel . 7. Could I set Moodle to send invitation, reminder, completion emails to respondents and progress report emails to be sent to me? Some of those features are available in Questionnaire. 8. Can I brand the questionnaire ? No idea what this means. 9. If the above is possible, I would need to use the questionnaire for fairly large numbers, say 100 x person A. Is there a maximum number of times, respondents for this sort of activity? That should be OK. I suggest you install Questionnaire and start a small-scale test to see for yourself how things work. Could you give us a few examples of what the questions look like? Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Diagnostic tool
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph, Thank you for your prompt response, I really appreciate it. I shall liaise with our IT department on Monday. Best regards, Di

ResponsesInList.Title: Export stopped working
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings, I have a questionnaire with about 50 questions of varying types. After a few students responded, I exported as text, and could open this file with a spreadsheet. I tried again when we had about 300 respondents, but now I get no results. The web browser waits for about 30 seconds, then returns a blank page (actually, no page, not even HTML headers). Any suggestions what might be going wrong? Here is the address of the page I requested: http://moodle.carondeleths.org/mod/questionnaire/report.php?instance=150&sid=123&action=dcsv (you won't be able to access this, but thought the code might help). Thanks, Lee

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Export stopped working
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Lee A 50-question questionnaire with 300 respondents, that's 1,500 questions altogether, and probably putting the stress on your server . You should turn debugging mode ON (briefly if that's a production server) and check if you get a PHP error report. Very likely a time-out error. On your PHP server you should consider increasing the time allowed to PHP scripts execution time. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Export stopped working
ResponsesInList.Text: Joseph, Thanks, it looks like that was the problem. I'm curious, however: I'm surprised it takes that much more time to generate the text file compared to creating the summary in "View all responses" (which I have no problem viewing). It seems that both have to process the same data. Lee

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Export stopped working
ResponsesInList.Text: Lee: "It seems that both have to process the same data." The process is not exactly the same. I'm afraid the "save responses as text" process has never been optimised, that's why it needs too much execution time in the case of large questionnaires with many responses... Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Moving or sharing questionnaire between courses

How do I copy a questionnaire to another course, or like in the "feedback' module, create a template? Thanks in advance. Jeff

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moving or sharing questionnaire between courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Select the questionnaire activity in an existing course. Backup just the questionnaire activity, without the current users data. Rename it something easy to find. Select a course without the activity. Restore the questionnaire activity to the existing course. it should be the blank questionnaire. If not, reset the questionnaire in course administration. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moving or sharing questionnaire between courses

I have attached the file with any student identification removed.  It is the last answer choice in Q8 where the problem can be seen.  I am using Moodle 2.1.3 and questionnaire version 2010110101. Thanks in advance for any help fixing this issue. Rob

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire export problem with long answer text

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph, Thank you for the quick reply.  I have attached a PDF of the questionnaire.  If you would like it in another format, please let me know. Rob

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire export problem with long answer text
ResponsesInList.Text: @Rob, Actually I'd prefer the questionnaire in moodle 2.1 backup format. Please go to your course and do a backup including only that questionnnaire (without any user data). Send me the exported file which will be called something like backup-moodle2-activity-questionnaire24-20111202-0950-nu.mbz so I can restore it and examine it on my 2.1 moodle test site. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire export problem with long answer text
ResponsesInList.Text: I have attached the backup file.  Thank you again for taking a look.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire export problem with long answer text
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the last file, Rob. I can spot the problem and will file a bug report with a fix any time soon. However, for longish choice texts, I would really advise using the "hidden" option, for exporting - in responses - shorter label s instead of the longer text values. This is explained (but needs improvement) in the Questionnaire documentation wiki. Here is what I would suggest for your question #8: Q.- What are you most likely to do when you see someone being bullied? Possible answers (choices): report=Report it to a teacher or staff member ask to stop=Ask the bully or bullies to stop Join in Nothing step in for friend=Step in if it’s a friend, don’t get involved if I don’t know the person(s) being bullied The full text of choices will still be displayed to the students taking the questionnaire, but the exported responses file will display the shortened form, much easier to read in your spreadsheet anyway. Q01->report    Q01->ask to stop    Q01->Join in    Q01->Nothing    Q01->step in for friend Oh, and you can actually edit your questions and introduce the shortened choice texts even after students have answered the questionnaire. It does not change anything to their answers. Hope that helps, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: questionnaire export problem with long answer text
ResponsesInList.Text: Reported as CONTRIB-3281 and fixed.

ResponsesInList.Title: What is the purpose of the 'rated' questions?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I have just downloaded the Feedback module (version 2006092900) into my Moodle system (1.6.2+), and it seems to be working as intended. However, there are two question types of which I am not sure the purpose: 'Dropdownlist (rated)' and 'Radiobutton (rated)'. They seem to perform exactly the same function as 'Multiple choice - single answer allowed (dropdownlist)' and 'Multiple choice - single answer' respectively. I have made a sample Feedback activity and used all 8 question types and have named each question according to its type. Click here to see a screenshot of the questions . I have then answered the questions as a student. Looking at both the questions and results page, it is not clear to me how the 'rated' type questions differ from the traditional dropdownlist or radio buttons. Since they have the label 'rated', I was expecting students to be able to select, or rate, the choices in order of preference, but it seems they simply select one of the choices, which is exactly the same as they do for the 'Multiple choice - single answer allowed (dropdownlist)' and 'Multiple choice - single answer' type questions. I must be missing something. Below you can find links to some relevant screenshots: screenshot of the questions screenshot of the results screen screenshot of the Excel file results Any advice will be greatly appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What is the purpose of the 'rated' questions?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, here is a copy of another post: -------------------------------------- with the rated items you can create scalable answers. Let me do an example: Question: How are you? Answers: super (5.0) good (4.0) solala (3.0) bad (2.0) as bad as possible (1.0) (3 users do answer 2, 2 users do answer 3 and 4 users do answer 1) Analysis: Question: How are you? When I try to edit questions in pre-existing questionnaires, though, I get the following warning: Warning : Attempt to assign property of non-object in ... Any help offered is greatly appreciated. Martin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Warning message: questionnaire 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text:
Martin, Unfortunately you do not say under which Moodle/Questionnaire version(s) your pre-existing questionnaires were created. Normally you should expect any questionnaire created under moodle 1.8 to work and be editable under 1.9. As far as I can see, line 24 in that manage_survey.php file is: 
```text
 $course->lang = $c_obj->lang; //fix for forced language in course
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: unable to view questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Usually a blank page is the sign of a PHP error somewhere. The only way to be sure is to display all errors. Unfortunately this is not very practical on a production site. Go to Administration ► Server ► Debugging and select Debug messages:ALL, then try to display your Questionnaires and see if an error message is displayed and report here. However please note that it is always very difficult to diagnostic what you call "an intermitent problem". It's up to you to track the exact conditions in which the problem appears and the conditions in which it does not. This takes a lot of experimenting and a lot of time. All the best, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Save/Resume option doesn't work
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello. I submit the issue again as maybe the first time I haven't been clear. What am I doing I am proposing a questionnaire where a user (with a role specifically created by me and with few permissions) can fill and submit his/her answers as many time as he/she wants. What's the issue When I set the questionnaire settings, I chose "No" for the option "Save/resume responses", because I need that every user always reaches the end of the questionnaire. If he/she leaves it halfway, closing the browser or logging out, I need the system not to retain the partial data in memory and, above all, I don't want that the user can get in later on to finish the questionnaire. What I am seeing so far is that the option "Save/resume responses: No", doesn't work. The user who leaves the questionnaire without finishing it, still has the questionnaire available once he gets back to it. Scenario I don't want Mark sees the questionnaire and wants to do it. He logs in and starts to fill it, but he doesn't have time to finish it, so it leaves closing the browser or logging out. Mark gets back to the questionnaire few hours later, logs in, and finds the questionnaire at the same point where he left it. So he goes on filling and then submit it. Scenario I want Mark sees the questionnaire and wants to do it. He logs in and starts to fill it, but he doesn't have time to finish it, so it leaves closing the browser or logging out. Mark gets back to the questionnaire few hours later, logs in, and finds the questionnaire is starting from the first question, forcing him to restart from the beginning. Thanks to anyone who will help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Save/Resume option doesn't work
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm not sure if I understand fully your explanations, but here are my findings. Questionnaire settings: Response options Type: respond many Save/Resume answers: No Create all existing types of questions (radio buttons, check boxes, Essay, etc.) Scenario 1.- Student answers questionnaire, answering most questions, including an Essay question type then leaves the questionnaire without submitting. By loging out, gets a warning message: "Changes you made may not be saved". 2.- Student logs in, goes to questionnaire: All previous answers have disappeared, except for the text entered in the Essay question . Can you confirm that that is your problem? That is to say that only Essay questions retain their contents? If so, I think this is not a bug of Questionnaire but a standard behaviour of the text editor used in Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Save/Resume option doesn't work
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Joseph, thank you for your reply. Yes the scenario is almost right. The only things I don't need are the warning message (we will already have one in the page introducing the questionnaire) and, most important, no answer of any type must be retained. All users leaving and coming back later on should restart the questionnaire from the very beginning. There is a logic here: the questionnaire is built to create and follow a stream of perceptions in the user, a kind of "narration", which the evaluators would then take into account. Interrupting that stream is not desired in the questionnaire logic. I add to this that it doesn't matter if the "interrupted questionnaires" and their partial results will remain in the final report, the one downloadable in Excel. In case, the file will be cleaned up from all partial results directly by the evaluators. I reply here to your answer to my other question, so we can unify the feedbacks here. The new role I created has as archetype "Student", you can see all its settings in the PDF here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JZkETJFzVE5VF3dESICzYoeRYvMAnYUH/view?usp=sharing . Thank you in advance for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: I want to create 2 Questionnaire  1 for Student Role and 1 for any other user role.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I want to create 2 Questionnaire  1 for Student Role and 1 for any other user role.
ResponsesInList.Text: I think, what you are asking, is how to assign roles to specific instances of a questionnaire? This is the same for any module. You need to assign specific roles to the specific module instance's context (see - https://docs.moodle.org/32/en/Assign_roles#Activity_Module_context ). You will also need to make sure that the other roles you don't want to access have been prevented in the same context. The capabilities you'll want to assign/deassign for a specific questionnaire are: mod/questionnaire:view - Ability to see that the questionnaire exists, and the basic information about it. mod/questionnaire:submit - Ability to complete the questionnaire and submit. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I want to create 2 Questionnaire  1 for Student Role and 1 for any other user role.

ResponsesInList.Title: Upgrading Moodle site with Questionnaire from 2.0 to 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: I am managing a Moodle 2.0 site which needs to be upgraded to Moodle 3.0.  According to the documentation, I need to upgrade in steps, first to 2.2 and then to 3.0. I know there were major changes to Questionnaire for Moodle 2.3.  So, my question is: when upgrading the existing site to Moodle 2.2, should I use the very latest version of the Questionnaire plugin?  Or should I use version 2.2.4 since that was the latest version built specifically for Moodle 2.2? Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle site with Questionnaire from 2.0 to 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: You need to ensure you match the version of questionnaire to the version of Moodle. So, when you upgrade to Moodle 2.2, make sure you use the most recent 2.2 version of questionnaire. If you then upgrade to Moodle 2.3, use the most recent 2.3 version of questionnaire. And so on. And always do test upgrades first! mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle site with Questionnaire from 2.0 to 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, one more question.  There seems to be no version for Moodle 3.0, the "Versions" page lists versions for 2.9 and 3.1.  My supervisor wants to migrate to 3.0 and not 3.1.. so, which version of Questionnaire to use? Thanks again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle site with Questionnaire from 2.0 to 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry. I must have hidden the 3.0 version by mistake. I have made it visible now. But, I would really recommend you upgrade to 3.1 instead of 3.0. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle site with Questionnaire from 2.0 to 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: According to the documentation, it isn't possible to upgrade from 2.2 to 3.1.  We would need to go 2.2 -> 2.7 -> 3.1 which adds additional time and effort.  This is a Time & Materials project which means that additional time/effort would cost more to the customer (government).  So, I would need to present reasons if we were to upgrade to 3.1. Is there a specific issue that makes you recommend 3.1?  or is it just general principle? Thanks again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle site with Questionnaire from 2.0 to 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: You can also go from 2.2 -> 3.0 -> 3.1. So you would need to do 3.0 anyway. 3.1, like 2.7 before it, is a Long Term Support (LTS) release (see - https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Releases#General_release_calendar ). While 3.0's support will end in June 2017, 3.1's support will continue until June 2019. Comparatively, the future 3.2 and 3.3 releases will end support in June 2018 and November 2018 respectively. Advantages of 3.1: Long support life - two full years longer than 3.0. Many new performance optimizations and improvements. Great new features . Additionally, the 3.1 version of questionnaire has been refactored to add performance improvements, and will perform much better than any previous version. Hope that helps. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle site with Questionnaire from 2.0 to 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire for Moodle 2.4 is available
ResponsesInList.Text: Questionnaire for Moodle 2.4 is available from the Moodle plugins Directory here . It contains a number of bug fixes and improvements over the previous version for Moodle 2.3. Please note that from now on, in accordance with the current Moodle "languages policy", all translations have been moved from the questionnaire/lang folder to AMOS . If the questionnaire strings have been translated in your own language, simply updating your installed Language packs in Site administration ► Language ► Language packs will install/update those translations. At the moment, the Questionnaire language strings have been translated - more or less completely - into those languages: German (de), Spanish (es), French (fr), Italian (it), Dutch (nl), Polish (pl), Portuguese (pt), Portuguese Brazil (pt_br) and Serbian (sr_lt). If you can complete the translations, please ask your Moodle language maintainer how to proceed. Also if you want to submit missing languages. Questionnaire for Moodle 2.5 will bring lots of new features, which currently need to be tested. They will shortly be made available on our github and hopefully in the official plugins directory later this year. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Matt, " Do you have an idea of when the new version compatible with Moodle 2.5 will be released? " The usual answer is "When it is ready". Seriously, the more interested people accept to test the beta versions, the faster we can release a stable version. " We would like to update our Moodle site and use questionnaire for many courses.  Or is the just released 2.4 version compatible? " I have tested the Questionnaire 2.4.2 version with Moodle 2.5.0 and it works OK. Except that it will throw a few error warnings if you set the debug mode to the maximum level (DEVELOPER). Nothing serious and does not prevent it from working fine. And of course we'll provide a new version fixing these warnings in the coming weeks. So, go ahead. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire for Moodle 2.4 is available
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, I understand the confusion. Any branch that has CONTRIB in it or WIP , even if it also has STABLE in the name this means it's a proposal for a bug fix or a new feature, for developers and testers. Again, "normal" users should only use the MOODLE_xx_STABLE branches. The "skip logic" feature was not "removed" from a stable branch, it was only available for tests, and has not (yet) been "pushed" to a stable branch. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire for Moodle 2.4 is available
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Judy, There is a huge gap between Moodle 1.9 and 2.4 and also between the Questionnaire versions for 1.9 and 2.4. I seriously doubt you can upgrade your site directly from 1.9 to 2.4 without losing any data (and not only for the Questionnaire activity). If it is vital for you to keep as much data as possible, the recommended procedure is to experiment on a test server , where you would install a complete copy of your existing 1.9 server moodle files and database , then upgrade that to Moodle 2.2 and then to 2.4. When you are satisfied that the upgrade procedure works OK on your test server, follow the same procedure on your production server. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can a questionnaire be used outside of a course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, you could add a questionnaire to the main page of your site. People would have to at least login as a guest though (use the 'login as guest' button). You can directly access the surveys in phpESP through the link, http://[yoursite]/[yourhome]/mod/questionnaire/phpESP/public/survey.php?name=[surveyname ]. Replace the [surveyname] with the name you gave the survey. But this won't use Moodle users, and isn't working within Moodle. You'll also have to add the line " require_once ( "../../../../config.php" ); " to the top if your /mod/questionnaire/phpESP/public/survey.php file (or use the one I've attached here - I'll move it into CVS ). But if you really want to do this outside of Moodle, I'd suggest just using the phpESP application itself. You can get it at: http://phpesp.sourceforge.net/ . mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Creating multiple questionnaires using template
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm wondering if someone can help me please. I am creating a page on our moodle site that will have around 50 or so questionnaires on it. It will be an evaluation page and I will use a template questionnaire as the basis for each new questionnaire, but will need to tweak one of the questions each time. I have tried doing this, but everytime I add a new questionnaire using the template, it duplicates itself in the 'content options' list when you go to create another questionnaire. Does anyone know a way to stop the questionnaire duplicating? I only need the one template to pick from, not 50 of the same template! Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating multiple questionnaires using template
ResponsesInList.Text: Which version of Moodle?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating multiple questionnaires using template
ResponsesInList.Text: It's version 1.9, thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating multiple questionnaires using template
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Lauren, Your problem arises from a minor bug that happens when a new questionnaire is made by copying an existing questionnaire (of any type: private, public or template). The original questionnaire does not, as you say, "duplicate itself", but unfortunately the copy you made from the original does not automatically take its new Title from its Name; rather it keeps its original title, hence the confusion. Here is how to proceed to avoid the confusion. Create questionnaire T01 Advanced settings, set Questionnaire Type as Template create your questions Create questionnaire Q01 Content options / Copy existing: T01 Advanced settings, Content options: Title: change from T01 to Q01 (i.e. match Questionnaire Title with Questionnaire Name. edit questions etc. Create questionnaire Q02 Now in Content options / Copy existing you see : T01 (your original template questionnaire) Q01 (the questionnaire you copied from T01) Hope this is clear. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating multiple questionnaires using template
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph, Thank you for your reply, that's really helpful and works as you say. The page I am creating will probably have around 50 questionnaires on it, and so those 50 questionnaires will all show up on the 'content options' list when you create each questionnaire - will this be a problem? i.e is there a maximum number that can appear on the list? Thanks Lauren.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating multiple questionnaires using template
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm glad it helped. The page I am creating will probably have around 50 questionnaires on it, and so those 50 questionnaires will all show up on the 'content options' list when you create each questionnaire - will this be a problem? Should not be a problem i.e is there a maximum number that can appear on the list? I don't think there is a limit there. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating multiple questionnaires using template
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok brilliant, thanks for your help Joseph.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Language - Bahasa Indonesia
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John, You posted that question to the Moodle plugins repository and I answered it yesterday as follows: @John, If you set your user language to Indonesian Bahasa, then you'll see that most (but not all) of the Questionnaire strings are available in that language. If you need all language strings to be available in Indonesian Bahasa, then you can translate them yourself on https://lang.moodle.org/ Notes.- You need to register to log in to that translation site and use the filters to view the translated/un-translated strings. Have you (or your admin) actually installed the Indonesian Bahasa language pack to your Moodle site? And have you tried to see which Questionnaire strings have not been translated? If you are an admin you can view those files here: YOURMOODLESITE/moodledata\lang\id/questionnaire.php, as in this short extract: $string['action'] = 'Aksi'; $string['activityoverview'] = 'Anda memiliki kuisioner yang kedaluwarsa'; $string['additionalinfo'] = 'Info Tambahan'; $string['additionalinfo_help'] = 'Teks yang akan ditampilkan di bagian atas halaman pertama kuesioner ini. (yaitu instruksi, info latar belakang, dll.)'; $string['addnewquestion'] = 'Menambahkan {$a} pertanyaan'; $string['addnewsection'] = 'Tambahkan bagian baru'; $string['addquestion'] = 'Tambahkan pertanyaan...'; $string['addquestions'] = 'Tambahkan pertanyaan'; $string['addquestiontosection'] = 'Tambahkan pertanyaan pada bagian'; $string['addselqtype'] = 'Tambahkan tipe pertanyaan'; $string['alignment'] = 'Perataan tombol radio';

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire plugin removing ID from divs
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan, I have no idea what is going on with your id's being stripped, but I can suggest two ways of possibly getting around the problem. If you just need people to be able to hear the questionnaire text, if you use a combination of the PoodLL filter and PoodLL Anywhere editor tools (Atto or TinyMCE versions are available) you can record directly in each question of the questionnaire. This is possibly of somewhat limited use as you cannot record in the answers. Probably a better possibility is to use the Generico filter with your "read speaker plugin" as I have tested it and used it to embed both audio and video into the possible questionnaire answers. A Video with Generico examples are available in the filter addons at https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=filter_generico HTH , AL

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic Linking
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm on a Mac I use "Smultron" plain text editor with the text files I need to PASTE into Moodle Questionnaire so this way any formatting is completely removed from the text. If I paste a text which contains, for example, the NAME of this Questionnaire, it immediately appears a LINK into the "Question Text" area of the Questionnaire. If I paste a text which contains a phrase "Helping Document Number 2" and I have a page in the COURSE with a link to a file named "Helping Document Number 2" this also becomes a LINK. I need to manually remove each word or phrase where this link was created automatically using the html editor and clicking on the UNLINK symbol. NOTE that I'm pasting UTF-8 text only, but even if I TYPE "Helping Document Number 2"the automatic linking happens. How do I disable this behaviour?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic Linking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Beto, 1.- The automatic glossary linking feature does not pertain to the Questionnaire module itself. It is a site-wide setting which you enable or disable in admin settings. If the name of your questionnaire generates an autolink, this is because you have turned Administration / Modules / Filters / Manage filters / Filter all strings ON . 2.- If you want to prevent the autolink feature when you are typing (or pasting) text in moodle's HTML editor (everywhere on your moodle site), not just in the Questionnaire module), select the text and click the "Prevent automatic linking" button on the second line of the HTML toolbar. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic Linking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph Once again thank you. It is kind of embracing that 99% of what goes wrong with my Moodle site it is because I did something I was not supposed to do... Anyway, I turned off all "automatic linking" I found in Filters. Regards Beto Boton

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire response order after adding responses in dropdown
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a client who comes to me for inquiries as we did their initial setup, and I like helping them out. They're having an issue using the questionnaire plugin in Moodle 2.9.3. We did not set this plugin up for them, so I don't know if this was the best option for the particular task, but they're using it so I'll assume they thought it was best at the time. It seems their questionnaire, which is related to collecting agency and work information has some dropdown responses which in some cases have a large number of options, such as the "which agency do you work for question" which has nearly a hundred. Every so often they have to add additional agencies to this list as they support new groups, and this works just fine if you add the new groups to the end of the dropdown list. Given the large number of possibilities they want this alphabetized, but when adding new selections to anything but the bottom it appears to cause previous answers to be changed to the one which occupies its former position in the list. This may be something as simple as a setting in the questionnaire they've overlooked, or perhaps this is just a limitation of the dropdown menu in questionnaires. I've searched for guidance on this particular conundrum, but no specific hits. As always any guidance would be appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire response order after adding responses in dropdown
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a know issue with questionnaire. Care should always be taken when modifying the questions of questionnaires that have already been completed by some users. When it was developed, it was assumed that questions would remain mostly static, so that response reports made sense. The problem with changing choices in a drop down (for example), is there is no easy way to determine if a change is being made to the text of an existing choice, if a choice is being removed, or if a choice is being added. The code assumes position is important, and assumes that if the text changed for an existing position, then that choice's text changed. If the list gets shorter, choices are deleted from the end of the list. If the list gets longer, choices are added to the end of the list. What needs to happen is that there needs to be a more extensive choice editor, so that selections can be made from defined choices. It is not a small change. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire response order after adding responses in dropdown
ResponsesInList.Text:
Thanks for the reply Mike. They were actually able to resolve it (sort of) yesterday with the following quick fix, though it is not a comprehensive solution: "-Embedded jquery in the HEAD using the form in moodle’s interface -Used JQuery script in the question body to re-order the options, putting the “Choose…” option on top still. This
only works if any new entries are added to the list at the bottom. 
Items can’t be removed, though if there is no better solution in the
future we may want to just find
a way of doing that in javascript while leaving the choice in the database for reporting purposes." It's too soon to know if there are any long term drawbacks to this approach.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I turn off the 'All participants' results chart?

I suspect there may be a demand for this as 'quality control' is quite a big thing and the whole guidance side of education I think quite rightly has a place in a VLE. I have used the questionnaire module extensively for student and staff surveys cross college and so it was a natural step to transform the student questionnaires which make up part of their individual learning plans to an online environment. Since these questionnaires are used cross college, the ability to have one course in which all students and their respective class tutors are enrolled in groups is preferable to replicating the same materials within every course, for statistical analysis I am sure also. It was only when I tried to set up the groups that I ran into problems. I posed my issue too to the Scottish Moodle Users Group (SMUG) and found that others had tried to do the same thing as me. One suggested solution was to give a non-editing teacher the rights to login as another user and so view their groups' questionnaire responses but again this was not group specific and teacher from group A was able to login as a student from group B. So I have given up on using the questionnaire module for this situation and will have to make them assignments, as this gives the required confidentiality within groups. I am not happy to do this as it is harder to train staff and students to use the assignment module than the questionnaire module, but as I need a solution for Tuesday 21st August, I am left with little choice I fear. Thanks Karen

ResponsesInList.Title: Complex course surveys
ResponsesInList.Text: I am trying to solve a problem regarding end-of-course surveys with Moodle and am not sure whether I am asking too much of Moodle or making the problem too complicated. We have nursing courses in which students evaluate the course and instructor and then have to evaluate their clinical instructor and the clinical site. Problem is that studnets may only work with one of four possible clinical instructors and one of 12 available sites. One unattractive solution is to create a very long survey and ask them to skip the sites or instructors that they did not work with. We have tried this with other software packages and students did not like it. I guess I could use groups to separate the individual responses??? I was also wondering if there was a way to use the certificate activity in the closing page of the questionnaire that students could print and bring as a ticket to the final? We would like to require survey completion but don't want to track individual courses. Any thoughts on this? I was thinking of creating a "course" that would just hold surveys and linking to the surveys in the individual courses. Any suggestions would be appreciated!!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Complex course surveys
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Lori - The "public" type of questionnaire is designed to be created in one course and "used" in other courses. The concept here is to create the "public" questionnaires in a course designed specifically to house those questionnaires and manage the responses. That way, you can limit the people who can evaluate the responses by limiting access to that course. For the certificate, the current one available in "contrib" can be set up so that it can't be accessed until specified activities have been completed. This includes questionnaire. You can also now assign a grade to a questionnaire that is given on completion. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Complex course surveys
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike Thanks for the reply. I figured the certificate would work that way. If I might trouble you for a few more details. Unfortunately we are the end of the semester and I don't have time yet to play around with this actually using Moodle. So it is a problem stuck in my head that I want to figure out. If you set up a "public" questionnaire, how would students access the evaluations? Through their actual course or through the course created for questionnaires? Here's a scenario...whatever details you can provide through this process would be great: NUR 101 is a course in which all 60 students need to evaluate the course. They also have smaller clinical groups (8 students in each) who will need to do separate evaluations of their specific instructor and site. So I am trying to figure out if I need to set up separate questionnaires and link to these individual questionnaires through their NUR 101 (e.g., Clinical Site and Instructor A eval, Clinical Site and Instructor B eval). Does that make sense? Also, if the certificate is set to be available once the questionnaire is complete, on what page is the certificate set up: the course set up for evals or their actual course page? I know this is a lot of questions, but we have the option of purchasing somewhat costly software to do this or use Moodle. I would prefer to use Moodle for a number of reasons, but I don't want to leave the software out of the budget if Moodle will not work with this. Thanks again for any of your thoughts...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Complex course surveys
ResponsesInList.Text: Essentially you set up a public questionnaire in a course that you will use to access that questionnaire's results, and manage those questionnaires. Nobody will actually fill out that questionnaire in that course. Then in any course you want to collect data for that questionnaire, you add a new questionnaire that "uses" that public questionnaire instead of creating a new one with new questions. All response submitted to a questionnaire that "uses" a public questionnaire submits that data to the public one in the course it was created in. If the users are allowed to see their own responses, they will still be able to see them in the course they completed the questionnaire in. But, to see all the results, you need to go to the originating course, and have access to it. If you want different questions asked, you will need to set up different questionnaires.

ResponsesInList.Title: Happy users of either Questionnaire or Feedback?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all, This is a frank--and probably, to the two developers, obnoxious--posting. Our organization was hoping to run one or the other of these two modules for course evaluations at the end of the current semester (in early May of this year). But we are now leaning more toward something like SurveyMonkey. Please help us stay with a Moodle-based solution. Are there satisfied users of either module who have actually gathered successful sets of data? Is either module truly "ready for prime time"? We've installed and tested both but find there are limitations to each one. Our ideal module for course evaluations through Moodle would do things that we have not found entirely true of either module: 1. Allow for anonymity but also allow the admin to see who has and has not completed the evaluation, by means of a log or automated email notification. 2. Allow a responder to stop part-way through, save, and resume the evaluation later, from a different computer/IP address if necessary. 3. Allow for export of all responses to Excel spreadsheet. 4. Allow for creation of questions in an intuitive manner and easily replicated format. 5. Not interfere with the rest of the Moodle installation in any way (Backup, etc.).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Happy users of either Questionnaire or Feedback?
ResponsesInList.Text: Sarah - On our production site I have made some custom changes that at least in my own estimation keeps the responses anonymous but traceable by admin, logs completion of a survey but does not show the student name, allows for number crunching by group, exports to Excel, has to option for saving and finishing later, etc.  I am using this modified version of the  feedback module to do our course evaluations. I am not sure how you do your backups but I know that Andreas plans on patching in some of my customizations and ensuring that things like backup and setup of the tables takes place as it ought. So I think 1-4 can be covered. I am not sure about #5 and since I have no graphical taste I will not comment on #6. Peace - Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Deploying Questionnaire School-wide
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I admin a Moodle for a small college and I would like to deploy a single questionnaire as a course evaluation tool throughout my whole Moodle. I know I can create a public questionnaire and have teachers deploy it in each individual course, but I am looking for a way that I, as site admin, can make a questionnaire appear in every course, then delete it after a week without asking anything of the teachers. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deploying Questionnaire School-wide
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ryan, Unfortunately what you want is not possible. The only way is for you, as admin, to create a public questionnaire in a special course with no teachers and no students, then ask your teachers to "copy" that public questionnaire to a private one in their course (or do it yourself), so the students can answer it in each course and you can view the consolidated results in your "special course". Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Submit button name breaks jQuery
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm not sure if anyone had this issue, but when using jquery to submit a questionnaire form, the post dies because the submit button is named name="submit". From what I understand, it's never a good idea to name elements with reserved words. I think the changes to make it work are pretty simple.  I tested it in v1.9.10 and it worked. // CHANGE IN ./locallib.php //FROM THIS (line 228) if (isset($viewform->submit) && isset($viewform->submittype) && //TO THIS if (isset($viewform->qsubmit) && isset($viewform->submittype) && //FROM THIS (line 509) if(!empty($formdata->submit)) { //TO THIS if(!empty($formdata->qsubmit)) { //FROM THIS (line 643) '; //TO THIS ';

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit button name breaks jQuery
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul, I do not understand what you mean by "... when using jquery to submit a questionnaire form, the post dies... " Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit button name breaks jQuery
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph, To clarify, it's not exactly a jQuery issue, it is a javascript issue (thus affecting jQuery as well).  These two links explain it better than I can: http://thedesignspace.net/MT2archives/000292.html https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TAP5-947 Basically, since "submit" is already a method of the form object, naming the submit button "submit" overrides the method "submit" thus making any calls to form.submit() void. If you are wondering what I am trying to do with this, basically I am putting a questionnaire form in an HTML block in the front page , and using javascript/jquery to validate the form before sending it off to mod/questionnaire/view.php (this is solely for design purposes - my client wants the questionnaire on the front page).  So I basically hide the submit button and add a regular button that triggers a event when clicked.  In the event function, the form is processed and (theoretically) submitted via javascript to mod/questionnaire/view.php.  This, however, doesn't happen since the submit button is named "submit". What does happen, is that the button doesn't trigger the event.  If I rename the button to "qsubmit", then the event is triggered, but even if all of the fields are filled out correctly, the form is still rejected and I am presented with the standard questionnaire field screen with all the fields filled out from the screen. What I think is happening is that somewhere in the validation, the script is checking to see if there is an object named "submit" in the post data.  Thus, we just have to find that check and rename it to "qsubmit" or the like. Best, Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Submit button name breaks jQuery
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul, Thanks for the detailed explanation. I'm afraid yours is a "special" request, due to the special way you are using the Questionnaire module. I hope you will find the relevant solution for your special use. ATB Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Upgrade Moodle 2.5 to 3.4
ResponsesInList.Text: i have recognized you have added 3 tables in db from last old version of questionnaire which we have used and those are : mdl_questionnaire_dependency  , mdl_questionnaire_fb_sections and mdl_questionnaire_feedback  . i want to know if i overwrite other table which store our data, will get any issue in feature ? if yes do you suggest to upgrade it ? thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrade Moodle 2.5 to 3.4
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi - There are many changes in function and data structure from the 2.5 version, so you should definitely upgrade with your Moodle installation. If you upgrade your Moodle to sub versions, you should also upgrade your plugins to those stop points. So, if your Moodle goes from 2.5 to 2.9 and then to 3.4, upgrade your plugins to their 2.9 versions as well. The questionnaire uses Moodle's standard upgrade process, which is designed to manage the data and ensure no loss or corruption. So as long as you do things properly with the upgrade process, you should be fine. That said, it is software, ans surprises can happen. You should always do a test upgrade on a non-production copy of your site first, and then verify everything went fine. Then make sure you keep a backup of your production data before you do the main upgrade. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove All responses view ## button
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, now I understand the problem (only occurring in 1.8). For guests to be allowed to take a questionnaire, it has to be set to Anonymous ( and to Respond many times ). In version 1.8, Questionnaire assumes that students (identified or Guests) are always allowed to see their own responses. The only possible setting about viewing responses is the View all responses (i.e. the statistics view). Unfortunately (from your point of view), this means that for anonymous responses, when a Guest displays " all your responses ", he displays the responses by the previous people who logged in as Guests as if they were his own , because "Guest is Guest". This complicated situation of Guests taking questionnaires has been discussed before in this forum. Actually, because Questinnaire has no way to distinguish one Guest from another Guest, using Questionnaire to collect data from Guests cannot work satisfactorily, simply because there is no way to prevent the same person to take the Questionnaire again and again, as "Guest". So the final results of your Questionnaire will always be questionnable. If your only problem is that of not displaying all responses to Guest users, then upgrading to Moodle 1.9 (and the 1.9 version of Questionnaire) will be the answer. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire not appearing in gradebook until after closing
ResponsesInList.Text: Using Questionnaire version 3.1.3 and Moodle 3.1.2. One of our instructors has added Questionnaire activities to a course and each one uses open and close dates (not Restrict Access), but the Questionnaire does not appear in the course gradebook until after the close date.  However, it *does* appear immediately in the summary page for the Questionnaire activity ( www.yourmoodle.org/mod/questionnaire/index.php ). Why would future Questionnaires be invisible in the gradebook but visible in the summary? A different instructor has used Questionnaire for a few years (also setting open and close dates), and all of hers appear in the gradebook regardless of the open/close date.  However, those Questionnaires were created in an older version of the plugin (not sure which version) and the courses have been copied over and over, with the Questionnaire details modified for each semester. None of the Questionnaires in either course are "anonymous".  All of them use "fullname". I've done my best to compare the two uses, but can find nothing that would explain why the new instructor cannot see future Questionnaires in the gradebook. Thoughts?  Suggestions? Many thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire not appearing in gradebook until after closing

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire not appearing in gradebook until after closing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, Thanks for replying. Yes, the questionnaire does appear in the gradebook as soon it receives one response and before the closing date, so my initial post is mistaken. The item is visible to all students at that point. However, in a non-anonymous questionnaire, it would be nice if it didn't require that "first student" trigger to appear in the gradebook. That way, a student could review their grades at any time and see everything that wasn't manually hidden by the instructor.  Seems like it would avoid potential confusion. Best, Glenn

ResponsesInList.Title: Problem with "Delete ALL Responses" and public questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm having a pretty specific issue with Questionnaire on Moodle 3.5 and 3.6 using Nginx and PostgreSQL on Gentoo machines - I've been able to replicate it on two machines so far. Both machines are running the latest version of Questionnaire - 2018121000. To replicate the issue: 1. Create three courses - we'll refer to them as Questionnaire Home, Questionnaire Outpost 1, and Questionnaire Outpost 2. 2. Make a questionnaire in the Questionnaire Home course, set it as a Public questionnaire. Give it at least one question. 3. Make a questionnaire on the two "Outpost" courses, using the content from the questionnaire on the "Questionnaire Home" course. 4. Submit responses on the two questionnaires in the "Outpost" courses, so that you end up with two responses visible in the "Home" questionnaire. 5. Attempt to use the "Delete ALL Responses" control in the "Home" questionnaire to delete the responses. You'll get a blank white screen, with no error messages in any log I was able to find, even with debugging at maximum. You can get around the error by submitting at least one response in the "Home" questionnaire - then "Delete ALL Responses" will work. This leads me to think that the error happens when you try to use "Delete ALL Responses" in a questionnaire that has responses, but all of those responses come from questionnaires other than the one you're using the "Delete ALL Responses" control on.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with "Delete ALL Responses" and public questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the report, and the the thorough description! I have added it as an issue here - https://github.com/PoetOS/moodle-mod_questionnaire/issues/179

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem with "Delete ALL Responses" and public questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Looks like the commit you added has resolved the issue. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can we combine two reports & export Questionire Modules Report to Excel ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, No, you cannot "combine" the data from different questionnaires. The solution, as you say, is to export the data and then combine the results in a spreadsheet such as Excel, or some other statistical software. The Questionnaire's Download in text format feature exports data as CSV (comma-separated values), which you can import into Excel without any problem . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slider input for rating
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, This is an old thread but hopefully it will be read again by someone. I too would be most interest in such a new question type in the questionnaire module. Visual analogue scales have many advantages over Likert responses types, both from a statistical and a practical point of view. New psychometric models are being developed for them, in the line of Item Response Theory. See for instance: Noel, Y. & Dauvier, B. (2007). A beta item response model for continuous bounded responses, Applied Psychological Measurement , 31, 47-73. Noel, Y. (in press). A beta unfolding model for continuous bounded responses, Psychometrika , . http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s11336-013-9361-1 and the discussion therein on the advantages. I have written javascript/php code to implement them. Here is an example (in French): http://yvonnick.noel.free.fr/qst/ I am quite willing to share the code but cannot engage in writing the moodle integration. Would there be anyone interested in developing this in the Moodle team? That would be great. Best, Yvonnick Noel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Tracking Student Completion of Anonymous Questionnaire Submissions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ricky - This is one of the feature already slated to be developed. Right now, 'anonymous' isn't completely anonymous. The 'questionnaire_attempts' table tracks all user attempts and stores the response id of the 'questionnaire_response' table always. 'Anonymous', prevents the userid from being entered in the 'questionnaire_response' field, and prevents the user information from being displayed with the results. But, you can always associate the entry in the 'attempts' table with the 'response' table and figure it out. The feature request will provide the ability to do both. Have the respondents hidden from the teachers, or have it completely anonymous - no associations at all. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Personality test: using more than one counter in answers by Fabio Roman
ResponsesInList.Text:
HI All, Fabio! I would like to follow up on a question that Fabio Roman posted last year but had no final response. As Fabio mentioned, is it possible to create a questionnaire that would give values to different counters e.g. Communications Style test: Question A. When talking to a customer or co-worker… 1.    
I maintain eye contact the whole time 2.    
I alternate between looking at the person and
looking down 3.    
I look around the room a good deal of time 4.    
I try to maintain eye contact but look away from
time to time Question B: If I have an important decision to make… 1.    
I go with my gut instinct 2.    
I consider the impact it will have on other
people before deciding 3.    
I think it through completely before deciding 4.    
I run it by someone whose opinion I respect
before deciding What I'd like to happen is that if the learner selects "1" on the above questions, then 1 point goes to the counter "Driver" Type Personality. If the learner selects "2" on the above questions, then 1 point goes to the counter "Amiable" Personality, if "3", then counter "Rational" and if 4, "Expressive". At the end of the test, the learner gets to see which is their most "dominant" communication style (has the most points on the counter). Has anyone ever done something similar using the questionnaire plug-in? If not can you kindly recommend an external application or resource that I can use, please? Thanks! Carlos

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Personality test: using more than one counter in answers by Fabio Roman
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Carlos, I also have a similar scenario as you do. I need to make a personality test in which the answers can have their own counters. So far I haven't found a solution. Here's what I'm trying to make: Let's say I have four different traits that I want to track: - Detail-oriented (D) - Leadership (L)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Personality test: using more than one counter in answers by Fabio Roman
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Adlan, I'm afraid this is not going to work, quite simply because your questionnaire is incorrectly built. For testing personality traits, you should ask questions where the answers are the opposite of each other. For instance, if you want to test the “Detail-Oriented” vs. “Delegates Details” Personality Trait, you should ask questions like the following: (taken from this site ) Q1 a. I like projects made up of many small tasks (0) b. I like to look at the big picture and develop new projects (1) Q2 a. I can see patterns in complex problems quickly (1) b. I enjoy research projects that allow me to hunt for specifics and spot errors (0) Q3 a. I am good with numbers, including positions in accounting and finance (0) b. I am good at strategic thinking and being creative (1) ... To test Extrovert vs. Introvert: (taken from this site ) Q4 a. I get more excited by ideas than by external activities . (0) b. I am primarily interested in and concerned with the external world. (1) Q5 a. I prefer a few deep, close relationships to many casual ones. (0) b. I prefer talking with someone rather than sitting alone and thinking. (1) ... Subsequent analysis of the responses would look like this: Respondent #1 Q1 to Q3 : score 0 = "Detail-Oriented" personality score 3 = "Delegates Details" personality I hope this makes sense. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Recurring questionnaires, when are they re-opened
ResponsesInList.Text: I have questions about the timing in a recurring Questionnaire. I have tried to specify the variations I can think of, but I might have missed some. This is information I cannot find in the documentation. When allowing the respondent to answer daily: Is the re-opening triggered at a specific time (like midnight), or Is the re-opening triggered 24 hrs from when the student submitted last? When allowing the respondent to answer weekly: Is the re-opening triggered by the first day of the actual week, or Is the re-opening triggered by the first day of the logical course week, or Is the re-opening triggered exactly one week from the previous submission (same day and hour) or Is the re-opening triggered by the day and time selected under Availability? When allowing the respondent to answer monthly: Is the re-opening triggered first day of the month, or Is the re-opening triggered exactly one month from the previous submission (same date and hour) or Is the re-opening triggered by the date and time selected under Availability? (I guess this is complicated due to different number of days in different months)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Recurring questionnaires, when are they re-opened
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Peter, I'm afraid the only way to find out is ... to try it out! Have you tried these various timings yourself?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Recurring questionnaires, when are they re-opened
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, it takes a while trying out a lot of these settings... I think this should be documented somewhere, or at least the people maintaining the plugin should know, though. This plugin has been around very long.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Recurring questionnaires, when are they re-opened
ResponsesInList.Text: They are all based on the user's last attempt time compared with date format codes . So if daily, the current "numeric day of the year" must be greater than the last attempt's "numeric day of the year" (format code 'z'). If weekly, the current "numeric week of the year" must be greater than the last attempt's "numeric week of the year" (format code 'W'). If monthly, the current "numeric month of the year" must be greater than the last attempt's "numeric month of the year" (format code 'n').

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Recurring questionnaires, when are they re-opened
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Recurring questionnaires, when are they re-opened
ResponsesInList.Text: That would mean that a weekly course survey would always open on Mondays (first day of week with our settings). I think it would be useful to be able to control that, to finish off every week with a survey (like, opinions on this week, expectations on next week). I’ll suggest that in the Questionnaire tracker.

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic model content synchronization within questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, We work with dozens of student recruiters (agents) who are in charge of filling up the same model form, which means each separate agent should have access to one occurrence of this model form while not seeing the other agents' forms. It is always the same person who answers "their" questionnaire, (by the way, this is the reason why I had been asking earlier on whether it would be possible to save incomplete questionnaires before starting anew with another answer while keeping a copy of incomplete questionnaires for later completion). The thing is that when we want to edit the model, we then have to delete all the agents' forms before replacing them with the new updated version of the form. It would be a real time-saver for us if we could synchronize all of these questionnaires at once whenever we modify the source model. I can understand this is not really the primary use that was initially intended for this plugin but do you think this is something possible ? Thanks for helping, Best, Yannick

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic model content synchronization within questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Yannick, I don't think what you describe can be done in a Questionnaire activity, without a leot of modification to it's code. I think I would use the Database activity instead of Questionnaire. With it, you can easily go back and edit an incomplete entry, like you want to do. You can also start another entry while keeping a copy of incomplete entries. You can even have multiple entries open for adding/editing, at the same time. Also, if you rearrange/edit your add, list, and view single templates, the changes will automatically show up and be used by all users.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic model content synchronization within questionnaires
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Al, Thank you very much for this piece of advice, I will take a deeper look at the database activity which does seem to be meeting my needs ! Best, Yannick

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Instructions on setting up Questionnaire with phpESP already installed
ResponsesInList.Text: To integrate it with Moodle, most of the user, group, private/public features were ignore. The code's still there in phpESP, it just isn't directly accessible to Moodle. You can play with it all from the phpESP management interface, but it is a scond level of administration and may not play well with Moodle. The intent of this application with Moodle is to use the Moodle access. When you add a questionnaire to a Moodle course, you have already limited access to the survey by the nature of the users who can access the course. Likewise, you can use Moodle groups. We may be using an older version of phpESP than you were using. In which case, it won't have the same feature you're used to. And on that note, are you trying to use an existing version of phpESP as a Moodle module? If so, that's probably why you're having difficulty. Moodle's questionnaire module is a customized version of phpESP, modified to work as a Moodle module. You can't just use any version of phpESP as a Moodle module - it won't have Moodle hooks in it. If you have installed the Moodle module version, you will see the settings for number of responses, and other settings, when you add the questionnaire activity to the course. mike

ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings... I have installed the questionaire module, and I would like to move an existing php installation over to moodle. Exactly how to do that is the problem. Can someone give me a hint here? Regards...   Tom

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Instructions on setting up Questionnaire with phpESP already installed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tom - If I understand correctly, you want to move existing phpESP data into Moodle's questionnaire module, correct? First off, this explanation will be possible only if this is brand new (empty) installation of the questionnaire module - in other words, you haven't created any questionnaires yet in Moodle. And, you need to be using some Moodle table prefix - default is 'mdl_'; if you haven't changed it, you're okay. Using phpMyAdmin (or other suitable MySQL program), copy all of the phpESP table into your Moodle database. You can export them to a file using phpMyAdmin and import the same file into your Moodle database. After that, rename each of the phpESP tables you imported into Moodle to the Moodle naming convention. This means adding the Moodle database prefix (if any, usually 'mdl_') and the questionnaire prefix ('questionnaire_') to the new tables. For example, the phpESP table called 'survey' will become 'mdl_questionnaire_survey'. If you aren't using any Moodle data table prefix, copy your phpESP database to a new database, rename all the tables in the copy as above, and then export/import. Hope this helps. mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Student questionnaire access
ResponsesInList.Text: I am experimenting with the Questionnaire activity and finding it’s a great tool for creating post-course surveys. There are a couple aspects of the student experience I am seeking to control and could use help understanding what is possible or any best practices to consider: Timing : The open and closed dates are hard coded as a specific calendar date. I often have courses open for a couple months and would like survey availability based on the user's completion date of the course. Is this possible today? Student access : It would appear that students can be made aware of questionnaire in two ways: Finding the questionnaire in the course as an activity. Perhaps at the end and made available once all of the required learning is complete If a due date is set, a participant can view the activity due date on the calendar. This could also trigger an event email reminder In an attempt to help students manage their required coursework and optional Questionnaire responses, I'm curious if there are ways to differentiate these activities . Are there any other options available to drive participation by using a Questionnaire block on the dashboard that contains links to these activities? On some LMS environments I have seen a separate list of feedback/surveys to be completed that makes it easy to do this. Might this be possible?

ResponsesInList.Title: Language issues in copied questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a questionnaire I worked out in English and I copied it so I could translate to Spanish. In creating questions in Spanish, I used a cut and paste process from an online document. The resulting questions, if the original has accents and characters specific to Spanish, appear to students with formatting code: &lt;!-- /* Style Definitions */ p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal {mso-style-parent:&quot;&quot;; margin:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; mso-pagination:widow-orphan; font-size:12.0pt; font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;} @page Section1 {size:8.5in 11.0in; margin:1.0in 1.25in 1.0in 1.25in; mso-header-margin:.5in; mso-footer-margin:.5in; mso-paper-source:0;} div.Section1 {page:Section1;} --&gt; Su ocupación, título o tipo de trabajo I'm not sure if this is specific to Questionnaire, or whether this question should be posed in a different forum. I'm looking for a way to translate this without starting over from scratch. Any guidance would be appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Language issues in copied questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ben, This is what frequently happens when you copy and paste from a Word document into a webpage: the Word formatting code is shows up. What I do is to copy the text into Notepad (or another text editor) to strip out the Word code and copy it from there into Questionnaire or any other webpage. You may need to redo the formatting. It's usually quicker to write directly in the online html editor. If you want to prepare offline, you could use something like KompoZer (free) to write the webpage. Then you can copy directly into Questionnaire . Word is designed to give instructions to a printer, which it does very well, not to create webpages, which it will do but very badly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire confirmation email date format
ResponsesInList.Text: In my time zone (Australia), date question types require dates to be input in day/month/year format, e.g. 15/05/2014. When I download Questionnaire responses in text format, dates are also in day/month/year format. However, when email confirmations are generated by Questionnaire, dates are formatted in year-month-day format, e.g. 2014-05-15. I suspect it's due to the Time API. See: http://docs.moodle.org/dev/Time_API Is it possible somehow to make the date format in email confirmations consistent with Questionnaire date question type?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire confirmation email date format
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for reporting this, James. I'll have a look ASAP. Joseph EDIT.- You write " When I download Questionnaire responses in text format, dates are also in day/month/year format. " Are you sure? Actually, dates in the "text format" download are formatted as yyyy-mm-dd in order to be recognised as dates when imported into spreadsheets. And dates in the email notification are formatted in the same yyyy-mm-dd format. Which version of Questionnaire are you using? Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Update Questionnaire won't allow me to edit questions
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a questionnaire which, when I click on "Update this Questionnaire", only offers me two tabs: "Settings" and "Locally assigned roles". But I want to edit the questions - how can I do this? The questionnaire is marked as public (which I suppose is correct) - does it have to be made private first? And if so, how do I do that? Thanks, Alasdair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Update Questionnaire won't allow me to edit questions
ResponsesInList.Text: Click on the actual questionnaire link and then you should get the edit questions tabs - although if it has been saved as public it cannot be altered. To be able to edit questions it needs to be saved as private or as a template.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Update Questionnaire won't allow me to edit questions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alasdair, You do not say which version of Moodle you are using. I expect you are using Moodle 1.9+. Here an extract from the Questionnaire online Help which should help you understand your problem. Joseph Questionnaire Type There are three types of questionnaires: Private - belongs to the course it is defined in only. This is the standard Moodle module concept. You create a questionnaire and its questionnaire content for the course it is defined in. Editing teachers of that course can change the questionnaire and all teachers can review the results. Template - can be copied and edited. This type of questionnaire cannot be used directly, but its content can be copied into a new questionnaire and edited. Public - can be shared among courses. If a questionnaire has already been created (in another course on the same Moodle site) with the "public" setting, then you may use that "public" questionnaire in your own course(s). The number of settings available to such questionnaires is limited and you cannot edit its questions nor view the responses. Example .- If a public questionnaire has been created in course A, it can be "used" in courses B, C, ... All the responses from courses A, B, C, ... are collected in the public questionnaire created in course A (the original course where it was created) and are viewable there by the person (admin or teacher) who originally created it.

ResponsesInList.Title: "Answer the questions..." Text font size
ResponsesInList.Text: How do I increase the size of the text of the link that says "Answer the questions...?"  Can I do it via CSS ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "Answer the questions..." Text font size
ResponsesInList.Text: That link is contained within the tags ' ', as shown in the template "templates/viewpage.mustache". You can either add CSS for that div class, or modify the template file in your theme.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.9 error installing questionary plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jairo, I cannot help you with this problem. Maybe someone else will. But I would like to point out that it is not a good idea to put such long error messages in the text of one's post. Much better to attach a text file to your post.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.9 error installing questionary plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: The error indicates that the questionnaire tables already exist in your database . If you are installing, that means Moodle doesn't know that it was already installed. if you are sure that there is no data in the questionnaire tables that you want to keep, remove (or rename them) from your database before trying to install the questionnaire.
